loans.name: Nhóm 09 Thôn Giải Trại Xã Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Chí works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Chí is 53 years old and she is married with four children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 09 Thôn Giải Trại Xã Công Chính solidarity group. 

In 2005, Chí joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chí has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chí has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chí hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 64 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Margarita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margarita has been in the pig fattening business for five years and also earns income from weaving.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 43-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a poultry farmer and at the same time, sells bananas in big markets and in the capital city Kampala.

He faces challenges of low capital and chicken diseases. However, he hopes to have a big poultry project.

Vincent has asked for a loan to buy chicks and feed for his poultry business.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for his poultry business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school and one who is still too young for school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Christine has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, operating at the market where she serves passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of cosmetics for her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics stock for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from her manicure services. Vilma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nursada

texts.ru: Нурсада, 40 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование у Нурсады среднее, она с 1994 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки коровы с теленком. Благодаря упорному труду Нурсады, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 10 коров, 3 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурсада планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, что позволит ей в будущем купить дом.
texts.en:
Nursada is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has secondary education. Since 1994 she has worked with livestock breeding, after having started this business with the purchase of a cow with a calf. Thanks to Nursada's persistent work, her farm currently has ten cows and three horses. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nursada turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and sheep to increase the number of livestock. Nursada plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, which will allow her to purchase a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and calves in order to increase the headcount of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to develop his work and expand his shop.

loans.name: Senorihna

texts.en:
Senorinha is married, she has one child, and has a kiosk where many people come to buy things every day. A loan of $600.00 is being offered to her to improve her business. She will buy additional supplies such as  phones,and  phone equipment 
Senorinha has been involved in business activities since 2012. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made her independent, as she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy  phones and  phone equipment

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Femme mariée, âgée de 55 ans et mère de deux enfants, ROSE vit au quartier Adidogomé et fait le commerce du charbon de bois depuis l’an 2000 et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois à kpalimé (une ville située à l’intérieur du pays), puis les revend au marché d’Adidogomé « Assiyéyé ».Vue la multiplicité de sa clientèle, ROSE sollicite un crédit pour satisfaire ses clients et gagner plus de profit ;ce qui pourra l’aider à mieux épargner en vue d’aider son marie dans les dépenses du foyer puis soutenir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A married woman, who is 55 years old and a mother of two children, Rose lives in the area of Adidogomé. 

She has been working selling charcoal since 2000. She procures her goods three times a month in Kpalimé, a town situated within the interior of the country. She then sells her goods at a local market.

Because of her growing number of customers, Rose is seeking a loan to satisfy her customers and earn more profit. These earnings will allow her to save more with the goal of helping her husband with the household expenses and then her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Gregory Gerlina

texts.es:
Gregory Gerlina es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder terminar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Gregory Gerlina, tengo 27 de años de edad. Nací en el pueblo de Tamayo al sur de Republica Dominicana y vivo en Bani, provincia Peravia. Tengo dos hermanas menores que yo, soy madre soltera de una niña de 3 años, vivo con mi madre la cual trabaja como enfermera en el hospital central de Bani.
Estoy cursando el 9no. Semestre de carrera de medicina en la Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo (UASD). Esta carrara me comenzó a gustar desde que crecí viendo a mi madre ejerciendo la enfermería, me fue apasionando de todo lo relacionado con la medicina y el poder ayudar a los enfermos y más a los que no tienen condiciones para pagar un buen servicio. 
De todas las materias, mi favorita es la cardiología, es por esto que tengo pensando en cuanto me gradúe poder hacer una especialidad en esta área. 
Necesito este préstamo para poder terminar mis estudios que son solo 3 semestres lo que me restan, pero se me ha hecho difícil por los medios de mi madre poder comprar materiales, libros, correr algunos gastos de transporte en general, ya todos (mis hermanas y yo) dependemos de ella. En caso de no ser posible que ustedes me de esta ayuda, no podría ver mis sueños y los de mi madre hecho realidad, además de que quiero servir de inspiración para mi hija, que en un futuro pueda ver que todo mi sacrificio valió la pena. 
Mis metas son ser una gran cardióloga reconocida, que pueda ayudar a mi familia y sobre todo mi comunidad, poniendo mis conocimientos al servicio de los más necesitados de mi provincia.
texts.en:
Gregory Gerlina is a young medical student. She is requesting a loan to finish her studies. This is her story:

My name is Gregory Gerlina. I'm 27 years old. I was born in the city of Tamayo, located in the south of the Dominican Republic, and live in Bani, in the province of Peravia. I have two younger sisters, and I'm a single mother of a three-year-old daughter. I live with my mother, who works as a nurse at the main hospital in Bani.

I'm in the ninth semester of medicine at the Universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo (UASD). My love for this career began as I watched my mother working as a nurse while I was growing up. I became passionate about everything related to medicine and about being able to help the sick—especially those who cannot afford good healthcare.

Out of all the subjects, my favorite is cardiology. This is why I'm thinking about doing a specialization in this area once I get my degree.

I need this loan to be able to finish my studies; I have only three semesters left to do so. Since my sisters and I depend on my mother, it has been difficult for me to cover expenses such as the costs of books, materials, and public transportation. 

If it is not possible for you to help me, I will not be able to fulfill my and my mother's dream. Furthermore, I want to be an inspiration to my daughter so that in the future she will be able to see that all my sacrifice was worth it.

My goals are to be a great cardiologist and to be able to help my family and, most of all, my community by putting my knowledge to the service of those most in need in my province.

loans.use: to cover her higher education costs.

loans.name: Nhóm 8-Khánh An 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luyen, 38, works as a farmer and makes about VND 500,000 monthly. She is married with two children still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2010.

Due to the family's economic hardship, her household does not have a sanitary toilet yet. With this loan, she can purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a septic tank latrine to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to the environmental protection.

In the photo, she is pictured first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine, with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Samnag's Group

texts.en: Samnag’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Samnag makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 65 years old, widowed, with 4 children who are all grown up and have their own family. Her husband, a fisherman, died after 5 years of their marriage, leaving all her 4 little children with her to raise and look after. When her husband’s death, she started working as a helper in the fish port where she cleans up scattered empty fish tubs.  With the little money she earned, she made it a point to save until she was able to set up a small capital for her to sell fish. 

She wakes up at 3:00 AM buying fish on the fish port and selling it on the wet market stall she rented and goes home by 10:00 PM. Her hard work in fish vending helped all her children to graduate in college.  Ideally, Benita could already retire from working. However, Benita says that she does not want to burden her children with her needs and that she is still strong and capable to work. 

She came to know of SEED on January 2014 through a friend who is also a member of SEED. Her first loan amounting to PhP 10,000 gave her enough capital to buy variety of fishes to include talakitok (cavalla), tilapia (St. Peter’s fish), bangus (milk fish), dalagang bukid (yellow tail fusilier). This increased her net income from PhP 1,500 a day to PhP 3,000 - 4,000 a day.  From then on, Benita’s business greatly improved. 

On her 4th loan now, she’s now asking for a re-loan amounting to PhP 30,000  to buy other seafood items such squid, shrimps, and crabs and sets of fish tubs and ice boxes which will be used for her 2nd rented fish stall.

Aside from securing her own needs, Benita also sees this as an opportunity to help other poor but hardworking individuals in their community. Benita hired a helper for her 2nd rented market stall. Seeing herself when she first started out in the business,  Benita supports her helper to earn income so she could finish her college education. She encourages her helper by highlighting the value of perseverance. 

In the future Benita wants to sustain her savings in anticipation of her retirement. Benita also wants to support other hardworking but deserving individuals in her community.

loans.use: To buy other seafood items such squid, shrimps, and crabs and sets of fish tubs and ice boxes for her 2nd rented fish stall

loans.name: Ingin Maju Group

texts.en:
These are the members of “Ingin Maju” Group who is posing in front of a cowhouse. The Group is led by the 65 year-old farmer Haji Asan, who is standing far left and wear a religious fez at his head. The other farmers in the group are Maysun, Sansan, Zizi, Joni, Cemin, Rimanep, Umi, Mahnun, Misdawi and Kemal. All of them live in Embung Ganang, a small village in East Lombok District, Lombok Island, Indonesia. Haji Asan has a family with three children. He also is a figure of religious and community leader in his village. 

Haji Asan has high hopes for his family and he strives to improve his economic conditions. A few years ago, with a minimum investment, he bought some beef-cattle which he fattened for resale. He also operates a small-scale vegetable farming. His business is going well so far. He was concerned to see many of the poor farmers in his village. So, he invited ten of his fellow farmers to establish a farmer group to develop their business and sharing advantages. However, he also concerned to see the cow dung was wasted without further processing and it started to pollute the surrounding neighborhood.

After socialized by YRE and Yayasan Mitra Membangun Masyarakat Sejahtera/YM3S (a local foundation – biogas construction partner of Yayasan Rumah Energi) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Haji Asan saw an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer. It will increase his family revenue. It seems like the biogas program would be the best solution for his problem. Haji Asan is keen to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other farmer group members to make it possible.

He have an optimism that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He also hopes that in the future, he can invite the whole farmers in his village to use biogas and also establish bio-slurry related business to create a new job opportunity to his surrounding neighborhood.

loans.use: to build bio-digester and use the bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 53 years old and a fish vendor. His wife, Adelaida, 44 years old, assists him in the business. They have three children, of which 2 have their own families already and 1 is 15 years old and still studying. 

He started his business in 2005 with only Php 1,500 initial and rolling capital.  From which, Danilo earns a net of PhP 800 to PhP 1,000 daily.  

In 2009, he was invited to attend an orientation in SEED. Having known of the potential to access loan for his business at a low interest rate, Danilo decided to join. He availed a 1st loan amounting to PhP 5,000 for additional capital for fish vending. From the increased volume of fish he was able to sell, Danilo was able to increase his income also.
 
On his 5th cycle loan now, Danilo is requesting for a PhP 20, 000 loan. He intends to use this to buy other valued fish and other seafood items to include tilapia, salmon, and squid.  Danilo says that with these valued fish and other seafood items to sell, he will be able to increase further his income and savings.
 
Danilo works hard to support his family, and specially the education of his child. On top of that, Danilo is also able to purchase a television set and a DVD player from his savings, which their family did not have for the longest time.

loans.use: To buy other valued fish and other seafood items to include tilapia, salmon, and squid which are  in-demand by his customers and other potential customers.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
A loan of IDR 10,000,000 will help Emanuel to introduce simple technology such as solar lamp, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community. 

Emanuel was born and raised in Larantuka, East Flores. He works as freelance graphic designer in this small town.

To increase his income Emanuel has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. He will use the loan to buy stock and grow his business. 

He plans to sell solar lamp to villages near his area that are not covered by electricity. Solar lights that charge mobile phones will be favored by his customers, as they will not need to go to town just to charge their mobile phone. 

Emanuel is excited about Kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, better promote them to his customers and improve his general business skills.

He is recently married and excited about extra income to support him and his wife.

loans.use: A loan of IDR 10,000,000 will help Emanuel to introduce simple technology such as solar lamp, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Gicela

texts.es:
Gicela es estudiante de la carrera de ciencias de la educación, ella sueña con poder ayudar a las personas que como ella quieran aprender y ser alguien en la vida.
Actualmente trabaja y a la vez estudia, esta poniendo todo de si para poder crecer y ser una profesional util a la sociedad.
Pide este prestamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y e esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gicela is a student who is earning her degree in Educational Sciences. Her dream is to help other people who want to learn and to make something out of her life.

She is currently working while studying. Gicela is doing everything she can to grow and become a useful professional in society.

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay for her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Tumaini B Group

texts.en:
Joshua is a father of four children who are in school. He is married and in his mid-forties. He has had a butchery business since 1996. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. each working day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan, which he paid back in full, to buy a business fridge, a meat cutting machine and meat stock. He is happy now because his business is showing good progress and his income is starting to rise. Joshua used the profit to cover school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, Joshua would like to manage a classic butcher shop with his own meat van. 

He will use this credit request to replenish his butcher shop with more meat. Joshua will share this loan with his group, Tumaini B, a five-member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his butcher shop with more meat.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat is a hardworking woman. She was born in a farmer’s family. She grew up working on the land and keeping livestock. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a builder. Before starting her business, she worked at a confectioner’s shop.

She has a business of keeping livestock by this time. She keeps cattle for two or four months and sells them in the domestic market. Every time she buys cattle, she sells them for an extra charge.

She has six big cattle now. She wants to widen her activity. She is planning to increase the turnover of her livestock. She needs financial support for buying livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock to increase working capital.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim, who is forty-six years old, is residing in Kampong Spue Province of Cambodia. She has four children in total. One is single and three are married. She is a tailor with a daily earning of USD 5. So far, she has been in this career for two years. Her husband, Tri, is fifty-six and works as a Tuk Tuk driver with a daily earning of USD 4. 

She would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Kimiyo

texts.en:
Kimiyo is a generous woman. She was born in 1977. She lives in rural area. She is a widow with three children. 

For about three years, she has had a business working as a seamstress sewing traditional dresses for women. She has a lot of clients and all of them are satisfied with her work. The sewing machine that she uses for sewing dresses does not work, so she wants to buy a new one. Kimiyo is asking for financial support to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Alicia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell through her fish-vending business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been in this business for five years. Maricel earns additional income from fish vending.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Janina

texts.en:
Janina is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Janina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Bella Moreta

texts.en:
Bella Moreta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicrafts business in the Philippines.

Bella Moreta requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like shells, nylon threads and wire for her business.

Bella Moreta has been in this business for ten years now.

Bella Moreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like shells, nylon threads and wire for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is sixty-five years old and a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 1,0000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like shells and wire for her business.

Letecia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells and wire for her business

loans.name: Tynar

texts.ru: Тынар 55 лет. Образование у Тынар высшее. По характеру она очень жизнерадостная женщина, работает учителем в школе. Также в течении уже многих лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 25 овец. На участке мерою 2,40 Га она выращивает экологически чистую фасоль, есть фруктовые деревья. Совокупный доход Тынар, в том числе от заработной платы  составляет около 9,200 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тынар обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и селитры. На прибыль от кредита она планирует отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Tynar is 55 years old. She has higher education. She is a very happy person. She works as a school teacher. She has also worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for many years. 

Tynar has three cows and 25 sheep on her farm. She grows organic haricots on a plot of 2.40 hectares. She also has a fruit trees. Tynar's combined income, including her salary, is around 9,200 som (KGS). 

To further develop her business, Tynar turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilizer and nitrate. She plans to use the income from the loan to renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and nitrate to grow organic haricot

loans.name: Ruslanbek

texts.ru: Русланбек, 41 год, женат, есть 4 детей. У Русланбека- среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи он занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2000 году, благодаря упорному труду Русланбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, на ежедневной основе он продает молоко, есть земельный надел мерою 2,05 ГА, на котором Русланбек выращивает клубнику, малину и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Ruslanbek is 41 years old, married and has four children. Ruslanbek has secondary education. As an additional income for his family, he works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, having started with this in 2000. 

Thanks to Ruslanbek's persistent work, his farm currently has five cows. He sells milk on a daily basis. He also has a plot of land of 2.05 hectares of land, on which he grows strawberries, raspberries and clover for selling. The monthly income is 25,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop his business, he turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) to purchase hay and livestock feed. He plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase hay and livestock feed in order to invest in his business

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a thirty-eight-year-old hardworking man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells maize flour and at the same time owns a motorcycle, from which he generates a weekly income worthy of 50,000 shillings per week. He faces challenges of limited capital, which hinders the progress of his business. Despite this, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. William needs a loan to buy an electric motor, which is a machine he will use to mill the maize that he sells.

loans.use: to buy an electric motor to mill the maize that he sells.

loans.name: Zihana Group

texts.fr: Madame VUMILIA, veuve de son état est présidente du groupe ZIHANA à l’âge de 46 ans avec 3 enfants. Elle exerce la vente de pains dans la rue en face d'un de marché de la place depuis l’année 2000 grâce à une aide venue de son église. Elle vient de solliciter un crédit qui lui servira à acheter 200 pains. Malgré la mévente et l’insuffisance de son capital, elle compte agrandir son entreprise pour devenir grossiste, renforcer sa capacité d’épargner et payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants. Elle remercie de vive voix HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes.
texts.en: Vumilia, a widow, is president of the group ZIHANA.  She is 46 with 3 children. She has been selling bread in the street opposite a market since the year 2000 thanks to assistance from her church.  She has requested a loan which will allow her to buy 200 loaves of bread. In spite of a slump in sales and inadequate capital, she is counting on growing her business to become a wholesaler, on growing her capacity to save and paying her children's school costs. She thanks HEKIMA with full voice for the support they give to women.

loans.use: to buy 200 loaves of bread.

loans.name: Bandu Group

texts.fr: Maneno est commerçante, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Bandu», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un Enseignant, âgée de 50 ans, mère 10 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des huiles de palmes dans un marché de la ville depuis 34 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 1000 litres d’huiles de palmes. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Maneno is a saleswoman, the treasurer of the Bandu loan group, client of the Hekima IMF, married to a teacher, 50 years old, and the mother of ten children, all of whom are in school. She started her business with funds received from her husband. She has been a palm oil saleswoman in the town's market for 34 years. She is going to stock up on 1000 liters of palm oil. She wishes to grow her business funds and to educate and feed her children. To finish, she thanks Hekima for the support offered to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To stock 1000 liters of palm oil

loans.name: Mary Gorreti

texts.en:
Mary Gorreti is a 43-year-old, widowed woman with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She is a farmer, growing food crops, like tomatoes and maize. She faces challenges of weather changes, accompanied by pests and diseases. In spite of this, she has a dream of completing the building of her residential house. 

Mary Gorreti has asked for a loan to buy agriculture herbicide to spray on her tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy agriculture herbicide to spray on her tomatoes.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a married woman who has been in business since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $1000.00.  She has her own shop and sells in the market. She also raises animals such as cows, dogs, pigs, chickens, and goats.

She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more clothes, including trousers, shorts, shirts, t-shirts, and other women's clothes, to sell. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, shirts, t-shirts and other women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Willian Xydali

texts.es:
Willian, de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, las condiciones económicas en las que vivía en su casa  y el número de hermanos, afecto para que él pudiera continuar estudiando, por esa razón tomo la decisión de trabaja en el campo, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa, también le apoya en los trabajos y tiene un niño de 2 años. 

Willian, se dedica a cuidar vacas lechera, por la mañana las ordeña y vende la leche; tiene más de 3 años de realizar ésta actividad, el sueño de él, era tener ganado propio y con trabajo y esfuerzo lo logró.- Tambien, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra platano y maiz, la ha realizado desde que tenia 8 años de edad, su padre le enseño el trabajo. 

La distancia que recorre es de medio kilometro, se desplaza en bicicleta y su esposa le ayuda en ordeñar, el horario de trabajo es de las 5:30 a 11:00 de la mañana.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar dos novillas que le venden en buen precio.- A decidido aprovechar la oportunidad ya que el precio esta cómodo y tiene la oportunidad de aumentar su producción, las novillas ya están grandes, les falta poco para que se embaracen y puedan ser vacas. El préstamo le ayudará a aumentar su ganadería.

Su sueños son continuar trabajando, ampliar su ganadería y obtener los ingresos suficientes para darles una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Willian is 25 years old and studied through the sixth grade. Due to the financial conditions he was living under and the number of siblings, he was not able to continue his studies. For this reason, he decided to work in the fields. Willian is married and his wife takes care of the household duties, but she also helps him with his work. They have a two-year-old son.

Willian takes care of dairy cows. He milks them in the mornings and then sells the output. Willian has been in this business for more than three years. His dream was to have his own cattle, so he was able to achieve this through his effort and work. Willian is also a farmer who plants bananas and corn. He has been doing this since the age of 8, having learned this type of work from his father.

Willian has to travel a half kilometer on a bicycle in order to do his work. His wife helps him with milking the cows. His work schedule is from 5:30 A.M. to 11:00 A.M.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of two heifers that will be sold to him at a good price. He decided to take advantage of this opportunity since the price is affordable and he will have the opportunity to increase his production. There is little lacking to prevent them from becoming pregnant and being full-grown cows. As a result, the loan will help to increase his herd.

Willian’s dream is to continue working, expand his herd of cows, and earn enough income to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy two heifers at a good price.

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат 31 год, замужем, 3 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. Образование у Нурзат средне-специальное. С 2008 года она занимается животноводством, благодаря ее опыту и неустанному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Нурзат есть 3 коровы, 10 овец. Дополнительно она реализует молоко местным жителям, экологически чистое и очень вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. Ежемесячный доход Нурзат составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Нурзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurzat is 31 years old, married and has three children of school and pre-school age. She has vocational education. Since 2008 she has worked with livestock breeding. 

Thanks to her experience and tireless work, Nurzat currently has three cows and ten sheep on her farm. In addition she sells organic and very tasty milk to the local residents. It is in high demand. Nurzat's monthly income is around 18,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase bull-calves. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for fattening up and subsequently reselling

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha, who is 55 years old, resides in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland located in her community. She has been in this type of business for more than ten years so far. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Beberly Gene

texts.en:
Beberly Gene is a married woman and a mother of three children from Dulag, Leyte. She has been engaged in a fish vending business for more than two years now. 

Fish vending is a lucrative venture. This is her source of income. In the picture, she is standing next to a pedal rickshaw that carries her fish storage bucket.

Beberly Gene is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell as well as a new weighing scale. A loan will help her increase her stock, thus allowing her to sell more fish to her customers. 

In the future, Beberly Gene hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell as well as a new weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish and charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Santa Teresita.
En este lugar vive don Carlos, tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad una hija aun vive con ellos. Su mujer es ama de casa.
El es un hombre muy trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no les falte lo necesario para vivir, el es albañil y  trabaja por contratos de personas particulares que le piden que les construya sus casas o cualquier tipo de trabajos relacionados con su profesión, actualmente está realizando varios arreglos en unas paredes de su casa las mismas que están deterioradas para lo cual requiere del crédito, así como también para comprar ciertas herramientas que necesita para realizar una mejor labor ya que es así como el se gana el sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar herramientas y materiales de construcción. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the lovely seaside town of San Jacinto, there is a beautiful beach that is located where the Portoviejo River meets the sea. In addition, this place is frequented by many domestic and foreign tourists. The Communal Bank named “Santa Teresita” meets every 15 days.

Don Carlos lives in this place. He is 56 years old, married, and has three grown children. One daughter still lives with him. His wife is a homemaker.

Carlos is a hardworking man who does whatever he can so that his family does not lack in their basic living needs. He is a bricklayer and is hired by individuals who contract with him to build houses or perform any other type of work related to his profession. Carlos is currently doing several repairs to the walls of his house, which have deteriorated. For this reason, he is requesting a loan. Carlos will also buy specific tools that he needs to do a better job since this is how he earns his living.

This loan will be used to buy tools and construction materials. Carlos has been with the Communal Bank for four years and enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help. His dreams include providing the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work and construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of rice to sell to customers. She has sustained her business through eight prior loans from NWTF. She hopes her hard work will help her save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mirasol works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from frozen foods. She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Mirasol has sustained her business with four prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like coffee, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, biscuits, etc.

Mildred has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from handicrafts.

Mildred aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like coffee, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 63 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Minda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, juice, etc. 

Minda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rayma

texts.en:
Rayma is 47 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

In the future, Rayma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is fifty years old and has two children who are in school.

Elena has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Elena has been in this business for sixteen years. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselyn is thirty-five years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Roselyn has a handicrafts business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Roselyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricar is thirty-six years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Maricar has a shell crafts business in the Philippines. Maricar requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more shells and other materials for her business.

Maricar has been in this business for sixteen years. In the future, Maricar would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more shells and other materials for her business

loans.name: Muhamudu

texts.en:
Muhamudu is a hardworking 38-year-old married man with 4 children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. To help him look after his family, he opened up a retail shop selling general merchandise, having acquired his start-up capital from banana selling and farming. He has been in business for more than 5 years. His shop is located along a busy street. 

Muhamudu dreams of building a permanent home for his family and wants to educate his children up to university level. However, he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to keep up with his customers’ demands. Therefore, Muhamudu is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to restock his retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en: Adolf is a fifty-seven year old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells cattle as his main business and at the same time grows food crops like maize and tomatoes. He faces challenges of limited capital, which hinder him from advancing his business. In spite of this, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Adolf needs a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman. She has six children, five of whom attend school while the other is still too young. Mwanajuma owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanajuma operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy women's accessories, cosmetics, and makeup for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her degree fees.

loans.name: Cielo Irene

texts.en:
Cielo Irene is a 28-year-old woman from McArthur, Leyte.  She earns a living through her poultry business. 

She has been in the business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. 

She is asking to take a loan to buy more chicks to raise and feed for them. This loan will help her improve her business’ productivity and sustainability. 

Cielo Irene dreams of improving her livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood stock to sell to her customers for her buy-and-sell firewood business.

Roselia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from selling coconut wine.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria is thirty-five years old and has five children who are in school.

Victoria has a handicrafts business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 2,1000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like wire, nylon threads and shells for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase wire, nylon threads and shells

loans.name: Guderia

texts.en:
Guderia used the previous loan to buy maize to sell. This loving and hardworking married woman is charged with the responsibility of looking after her 6 children. They live in Fort Portal. 

Her business is buying maize and selling it along with other fresh foods as her side income. She is also into banana growing, having been in the business since 1980. She usually complains that changes in the weather hinder her expected returns.

Guderia maintains her dream of building a permanent house for her family. She will use the loan to buy mulches for her banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy mulches for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products for selling.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Fatuma operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is a hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He operates a retail shop as his main source of income. He also practices farming to earn additional income. He started this business to earn a living. He has a vision of constructing a residential house although price fluctuation of the products he deals in is a challenge to him.

He is requesting a loan to buy soap, sugar, salt and loaves of bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, salt and loaves of bread

loans.name: Tweyambe Women Group

texts.en:
Rhoda is a thirty-four-year-old single mother with two children of which both in school. She is a first-time borrower from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd and a resident of Sekanyonyi Gayaza Road. She has taken a loan of 500,000 for the purpose of boosting her business. She will buy medicine for sale to her customers. She is an enrolled nurse who owns a drug shop in an area where she has good business.

She is honest and God-fearing, which has helped her to succeed in her career. She is so grateful for the services of Kiva and in future, she hopes to borrow more money from the institution so as to improve on her incomes. Her dream is to borrow money and buy a plot of land for her family and also build a home for them.

loans.use: To buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cocoa and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Zubin

texts.en:
Zubin is 46 years old. His first wife died after an illness and left him a daughter. A few years later, he married his present wife and had two more children. His elder daughter is in college, while the other two children are in senior and primary school, respectively. He is also supporting his parents, who are both farmers.

Zubin began raising pigs six years ago. He and his wife are honest and hardworking. In those years, they used their income to build their house and set up a methane tank. They lead a happy big family life.

This year, Zubin faced a serious problem in that more than 20 of his pigs died without a known reason. This situation makes the family feel embarrassed. So he requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred to buy more piggies. He hopes that his family can have a easier life.

loans.use: to buy more piggies

loans.name: Erick Alexander

texts.es: Erick de 41 años de edad tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y tacos desde hace varios años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar,vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo el solicita nuevamente un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y tacos como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, carnes, entre otros ingredientes ya que le ha ido bien sus ventas, y para tener mejores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Erick, aged 41, lives in his own home with his life partner and their son. 

He has been running a business selling sandwiches and tacos for many years now. He has a very good clientele because he sells his food at a reasonable price. With the profits that he makes, he covers some of his household expenses. 

Since he has had good sales, he is requesting a new loan that will allow him to buy everything he needs to make his sandwiches and tacos such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadella (a large Italian sausage), and meat—among other ingredients. This way, he will be able to generate better profits and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadella, and meat— among other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of products and some fabrics to resell

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, 34, is a married man from Kampong Speu province. He has two children who are currently in school. He is a construction worker with a daily earning of $7. He has been in this career for nine years. His wife Mara, 33, is a tailor with a daily earning of $6. 

Recently, parts of Saran's house have deteriorated and must be fixed to provide a suitable living space. He has applied for a Kiva loan through HKL to cover the cost of renovation. 

Saran and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for house renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grocery items: palm oil, dried fish, and more to resell

loans.name: Humberta

texts.es: Humberta de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Humberta, 34, lives in her own house with her life partner.  She has had a small store in her home for 15 years.  She has a lot of customers because of her good prices and her friendliness when it comes time to make a sale.

She's requesting a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, pan dulce [sweet bread], and so on.  That way she can earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, pan dulce [sweet bread], etc.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genara is fifty years old and has two children who are still in school.

Genara has a firewood and charcoal vending business in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Genara has been in this business for ten years. Genara would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Somsoore 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mr SOUMAILA est le responsable du groupe SOMSOORE II. Marié, il est maintenant père d'un (01)enfant âgé d'un (01) an. Il a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mr vend des prêt à porter depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Il veut s’acheter 02 douzaines de chemise et 20paires de pantalons.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il souhaite ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. SOUMAILA is the official of the group SOMSOORE II. He is married and now a father of a 1-year-old child. He has two persons to support. Mr. SOUMAILA has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for six years. He gets his supplies from the market in his sector. He wants to purchase 2 dozen shirts and 20 pairs of pants. He wants to reinvest his profits in his business. He would like to open a ready-to-wear shop and to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 dozen shirts and 20 pairs of pants

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Jorge montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa. 
La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 
Con sus trabajos, Jorge ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 
Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Jorge busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una moto para transportar sus insumos y poder trabajar de una manera mas cómoda y económica.
Jorge espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 
Además, Jorge espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Jorge launched his clothing workshop with the aim of generating income to pay for the expenses associated with the home he lives in with his wife and three children. He learned his trade by taking some courses. Because of his training, his work is characterized by its good quality and timely delivery. George has captured a large number of customers through his work, ensuring very good monthly sales. He expects his business to continue to grow and later to generate employment for those most in need.

In order to respond to customer demand, Jorge is requesting a loan that will enable him to purchase a motorcycle to transport his products and to work in a more comfortable and economical way. Jorge hopes that in this way his family can benefit from improved revenues. This will allow them to have a better quality of life and a better education. Additionally, Jorge hopes that his business continues to grow at a good pace so his workshop can generate at least one job for a person who needs it and has no other job opportunities.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to transport goods.

loans.name: Khalel Al- Wadi Group

texts.en:
Khalel Al- Wadi is a group of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They live in the same neighborhood and are friends. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

One of the group members is Efrikia, who is the leader of the group. Efrikia is a married woman with six children. She lives with them in a small house that has two rooms, a bathroom and a small kitchen. The family feels inconvenienced by these cramped conditions. The father works hard to make the necessary expansions of the house but his income is small. As a result, Efrikia turned to Al- Amal Microfinance Bank to take a loan of 50,000 Yemeni Rails (YER) to purchase iron steels and cement to make an extra room.

Efrikia hopes to make her house spacious and comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase iron steels and cement to make an extra room.

loans.name: Sara Soraida

texts.es:
Sara, de 50 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado de estudio, está acompañada y su compañero de vida es pescador en la zona donde ellos residen, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos están estudiando.

Sara, se dedica a  los oficios domésticos de su hogar, uno de sus hijos que reside en los Estados Unidos,les ayuda económica para cubrir los gastos de la casa; aparte de los ingresos que su compañero de vida aporta.

Sara, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar hierro para poder reparar algunas de las puertas de su casa, ella necesita soldarlas y pagar quien le haga ese trabajo. 

Los sueños de Sara son, que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tener un negocio propio en las orillas de la calle de su casa.
texts.en:
Sara, 50, didn't go to school.  She's in a relationship and her life partner's a fisherman in the area where they live.  She has four children, two of whom attend school.

Sara's a homemaker.  One of her children lives in the United States and helps them financially to cover the household expenses.  This is in addition to the income her partner contributes.

Sara's requesting the loan to buy rebar to be able to repair some of the doors of her house.  She needs to patch them up and pay whoever does that work.

Sara's dreams are for her children to finish school and to have her own business on the sidewalk in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy rebar to be able to repair some of the doors of her house

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel (Emma) is thirty-one years old, married and has a child of two years. He lives in Kyotera, a  small town in Central Uganda. Emma studied at the Kammengo Institute to become a technician. Afterwards he joined a distribution company, Dembe Traded Enterprises, that sells big home solar systems. There he worked as a solar technician for two years.

Emma always planned to become an independent entrepreneur and saved his earnings to collect enough capital to start his own business.  After two years working as a solar technician, he had saved enough to make his dream come true: he started Solar Home Systems, his company that is selling big solar systems as well as pico solar systems (solar lanterns). Emma employs a secretary and technicians in his business, which he has been running successfully and continuously growing for seven years now.  

Dealing with energy-efficient products, Emma wanted to sell energy-efficient stoves as well and became an UpEnergy distribution partner three years ago.  When he is installing his solar systems for his customers, he travels into deeply rural areas, where people are in need of energy-efficient cooking methods as well and thus he also provides his clients with energy-efficient cooking stoves. Emma aims to scale up his stove business, but transportation, logistics and capital limitations are challenges he is facing. Investing all the money in inventory, he is not able to afford better transportation methods, which would help him to sell more. So far he has hired a van, which raises his costs and reduces the capital available for useful investments. Furthermore Emma cannot stock as many stoves as people demand because of high upfront costs. Another obstacle for selling more stoves is that he cannot sell them from his shop because he does not own a space to display and store the stoves safely. 

With the help of the Kiva loan, Emma will be able to receive and stock enough inventory for one month. He will pay back the inventory he received one month later from the revenues from the sales of the energy-efficient stoves. This procedure will repeat monthly. Furthermore he will purchase a tricycle to be able to transport more stoves in a cost effective way to his customers in rural areas. One time a month, he will also do a special sales trip in the region and rent a truck and a public announcement system, to promote and sell stoves. The Kiva loan will provide a way to lease the truck and speaker system six times. After these six months, Emma will be able to afford the lease fees from his, by then generated, savings. The Kiva loan will also be used to buy a secure storage area so that Emma can display, sell and store stoves in front of his shop. 

For him, the benefit of working with UpEnergy is getting an interest free loan, which is a precondition to scale up. Furthermore, the fact that UpEnergy provides genuine, high quality energy-efficient products that people appreciate and that improve people’s life, creates a  good reputation for him and his his business.

For Emma, the biggest benefit of using energy-efficient stoves is that people save money and time.  In his community, he observes that people’s lives improve because they have more money. Also deforestation is reduced considerably, which is important to mitigate climate change and to, thus, reduce the threat of drought.

He dreams about scaling up his shop, to be able to have a good life, meaning he can afford a good school for his child and medical treatment for his family.

loans.use: to scale up his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es un violinista profesional, lleva muchos practicando y trabaja en  la sinfonica nacional boliviana Daniel quiere un credito para comprar un violin nuevo Daniel es un hombre divorciado pero se ha quedado a cargo de dos hijos los cuales el quiere mucho Daniel y su familia viven en la casa de sus padres En el futuro Dniel espera comprar una casa
texts.en:
Daniel is a professional violinist. He has been doing this for many years, and plays in the Bolivian National Symphony.

Daniel wants a loan in order to purchase a new violin. Danielle is divorced but he has been left with responsibility for two children whom he loves very much. Danielle and his family live in the home of his parents. Someday Daniel hopes to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy a new violin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Zokir

texts.en:
Zokir is a handsome man. He was born in 1951. He is living in a rural area. He is married and has one child. He is a metal-worker.

Zokir started his activity in 2009. He likes his job. He works hard and is persistent. He is a responsible, honest, generous person. All his clients are satisfied with his work.

Zokir is planning to refresh his activity. He wants to buy equipment. He needs financial support in order to buy metal for increasing working capital. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy metal for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en: Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children. Four of her children go to school. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She has no additional family members. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes transportation. She wants to buy a van to ease her transportation challenges. She lives in her own house. The family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna, who is 54 years old, resides in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has three children who currently work in a garment factory. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland in her community. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. On average, she makes USD $5 in a day.

Vanna is requesting a Kiva loan through HKL to buy a motorbike so she can travel more easily. She would like to thank all her lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Pedro Martes

texts.es:
Pedro, a sus 49 años de edad, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. Ser padre de dos hijas, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijas. 
Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años, comenzó a fabricar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas solo, Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará una maquina de confección y materia prima como cuero y suelas, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada escolar, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Pedro manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.


Anímate a prestar al negocio de Pedro!
texts.en:
Pedro is 49 years old and is a charismatic, active, and helpful man. Being the father of two children has motivated him to fight tirelessly from day to day and look for ways to earn a living and support his children. About 10 years ago, he began to make shoes for all types of customers. They are high quality and fairly priced, which has allowed him to become well-known in his area and achieve a good trajectory. He works alone every day for 8 hours per day.

This has brought him to request a loan in order to supplement his inventory. He will purchase a sewing machine and soles so that he can satisfy the demands that arise during the school year. This will help him to increase the income that he receives from his work.

Pedro tells us that his age does not impede him and he continues to do what he is passionate about. He is always thinking of new goals, including becoming a successful shoe distributor and generating job opportunities. This way, he will be able to improve his quality of life and the wellbeing of his family and those who help him to do his work each day. 

Help Pedro by loaning to him!

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and primary materials like leather and soles.

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, esta estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, el con mucho esfuerzo esta estudiando y quiere poder sobresalir en la carrera que eligió para poder ser un profesional útil a las demás personas. Comenta que su anterior préstamo de kiva le fue de mucha ayuda y que pudo seguir con sus estudios.
Hoy pide nuevo este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Eder is from the city of Ybycuí and pursuing a degree in Accounting Sciences. With great effort, he is studying so that he can excel in the degree program he selected in order to become a useful professional to other people. Eder said that his previous Kiva loan was a great help and he was able to continue his studies.

Today he is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 50 years old. She is married with 4 children ages between 13 and 23 years, all of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been for 15 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more bed covers and bed sheets to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more bed covers and bed sheets to resell.

loans.name: Angel Domingo

texts.es: Angel de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica a la comercialización de artesanías  (trabajo en madera, hilo, semillas, etc.), tiene más de 9 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de todo tipo de artesanía por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Angel, 41 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and 4 children. He markets handicrafts (woodworking, thread, seeds, etc.) and has over 9 years of experience with this activity. With his sales he has been able to cover some household expenses. He is asking this loan to buy all types of handicrafts wholesale and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy all types of handicrafts wholesale.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.fr: Madame KUMBUKA est présidente du groupe GRACE. A l’âge de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants, tous empruntant le chemin de l’école. Elle s’occupe de la vente de sous-vêtements  au marché. Elle  vient  de solliciter un  prêt qui lui servira d’acheter 5douzaines de caleçons pour enfants, 5 douzaines de chaussette, 3 douzaines de t-shirt et payer le transport.Son vœu est de prospérer dans ses affaires. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en: Ms. Kumbuka is the president of the Grace group. At the age of 36, she is married and the mother of 7 children, all on the path of education. She works in the sale of undergarments at the market. She has come to ask for a loan which will serve to buy 5 dozen pairs of boxers, 5 dozen pairs of socks, 3 dozen of t-shirts, and to pay for transport. Her wish is to prosper in her business. She thanks Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items to resell

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha es una joven estudiante, vive y trabaja como empleada domestica para solventar los gastos de su facultad, es muy dedicada al estudio es una buena persona que desea sobresalir con sus esfuerzos a través de su esfuerzo.
Está estudiando la licenciatura en farmacia, y pone todo de sí para poder ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a young student who is working as a live-in housekeeper so that she can pay her educational expenses. She is very dedicated to her studies and is a good person who wants to work hard and excel as a result of her efforts.

Mirtha is studying for a degree in Pharmacology. She is doing everything that she can to make something out of her life. Mirtha is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees. As a result, she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Dukore Group

texts.en:
The group is called Dukore which means “worker” in English. The group members sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to be able to change their futures for the better. 

Clementine is the 43-year-old group leader. She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 16 years, and 3 of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been running her business for 4 years. With her loan portion, she would like to buy more sorghum and beans to resell. The profits from her business will be used to both further expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and beans to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, and a stainless steel cart.

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.en: Sidoniya is a group leader; aged 43. She is married with four children aged between 2 and 13 years, all of whom go to school. The group is called TWIYUBAKE, which means “BUILD OURSELVES” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to improve their future. She sells food stuffs and has been running the business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, bananas and potatoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, bananas and potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Asumani

texts.en: Asumani is a 39-year-old Ugandan married man. He lives in Kagadi, where he sells produce and owns rentals to earn a living. He hopes to increase his family’s income through increased sales despite competition leading to income disparities. Since he is hard working, Asumani is requesting a loan to buy cassava and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava and maize to sell

loans.name: Mirembe  Get Out Of Poverty Group

texts.en:
Betty is 28 years old and married with two children. She is a second time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. She has borrowed a loan through the group to stock up for the season of Christmas. She runs a salon at the city complex, an arcade in the city. She is a resident of Gayaza in Wakiso district.

Her customers are the passers-by and friends who appreciate the work she does. She loves her work and gives a lot of attention to her customers in order to keep them. Hence, she has customer care at work. She is so grateful to the institution for the support given to them and promises to borrow more money along with other group members in order to look after her children and provide all the basic needs for them.

The sixth person in the picture is the UGAFODE staff member in charge of the group.

loans.use: To buy hair oils for her salon

loans.name: Marlis Esperanza

texts.es:
Marlis, de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor y tiene 2 hijos.- Ella trabaja por las noches en una empresa de limpieza de pescado y en el día vende minutas en su comunidad y sus  alrededores. 

Marlis, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de minutas, desde hace dos años ella se ha dedicado a este negocio.

Marlis, solicita el préstamo para comprar otro carretón para que su esposo también salga a vender minutas y de esta manera ampliar más el negocio.
Los sueños de Marlis son, ampliar su negocio, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y que sus dos hijo logren ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Marlis is 30, she studied up to 6th grade, she has a partner, he works in agriculture and they have two children.  She works night shifts for a fish-cleaning company and during the day she sells shaved ice in her community and surrounding areas.

Marlis has a small business selling shaved ice, she’s had this business for two years.

Marlis requests a loan to buy another cart so that her husband can also go out to sell shaved ice and this way expand the business.  Marlis dreams are to expand the business, increase the quality of life of her family and that her two children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy another cart so that her husband can also sell shaved ice and expand the business.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en:
Rajabgul is 26 years old and single. She lives in Dangara district with father, mother, and two younger brothers. 

After graduation from high school, Rajabgul couldn't enter college and so decided to be a dressmaker. With help from her mother, she began sewing national dresses six years ago. She really likes her job because she always pleases her customers with beautiful dresses.
