Today Rajabgul wants to increase her production, but without a modern machine it is impossible. That is the reason she is requesting a loan. With your help, she can increase her income and improve her life.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Faith, a 47-year-old smallholder farmer from Kenya. She is a mother of three lovely children; the oldest is 22 and the youngest is 9. Faith, born first in a family of five, has described her childhood as supported. For this reason, she is doing everything in her power to provide her children with an even better upbringing than she had. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva to help aspiring women farmers like Faith to turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan / asset financing.

Faith owns one acre of land in Igoki Location, near the town called Nkubu, Kenya. On the farm, she keeps three dairy cows. She also grows crops such as vegetables and bananas for both family consumption and to sell in the market. Faith has been farming for the last 10 years. To build her business network, she became a member of a small group of fellow smallholder farmers who empower each other to become better entrepreneurs. 

Faith is seeking a loan to buy animal feed and a chaff cutting machine. The financial benefits she will reap from the loan are almost immediate. The machine will cleanly and evenly chop hay into suitable sizes for cows to eat and digest easily. 

From her loan appraisal, Faith is disciplined with money - She updates her budget on a monthly basis, tracks every income and expense and approaches new business opportunities eagerly.

loans.use: to pay for animal feed and a chaff cutting machine

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet David. He is a 28-year-old farmer from Kipsaiya village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He lives together with his wife and four children on a small piece of land where he keeps dairy cows, poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. For ten years, his primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. 

David's biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. David made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime last month, he applied for a loan for expanding his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output. 

The additional income from the expansion will go to David's children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive for low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, David's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last 18 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children through school and also buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Dilia Maydita

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Santa Teresita.
En este lugar vive la señora Dilia, tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, de 23, 18 y 12  años de edad, la menor estudia en colegio dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Dilia es una gran ama de casa, ella en sociedad con uno de sus hijos se dedican a la compra y venta de frutas, tres veces por semana su hijo se desplaza a los campos allí el compra maracuyá, papayas, piñas, melones los mismos que transporta en su carro a Quevedo lugar en el cual vende a comerciantes minoristas, ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en la agricultura ya que el siembra en la época invernal. De esta forma ellos salen adelante trabajando día a día honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar piñas, maracuyá y semillas para la agricultura. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda el Grupo. Sus sueños tener un camión ya que el carro que tienen es pequeño.
texts.en:
In the lovely seaside town of San Jacinto, there is a beautiful beach that is located where the Portoviejo River meets the sea. In addition, this place is frequented by many domestic and foreign tourists. The Communal Bank named “Santa Teresita” meets every 15 days.

Sra. Dilia lives in this place. She is 43 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 23, 18, and 12). The youngest child is in school and the other two children still live at home. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña Dilia is a good housewife. She and one of her children buy and sell fruit. Three times a week, her son travels to the fields to buy passion fruit, papayas, pineapples, and melons and then transports them by car to Quevedo, a place where small retailers sell their goods. Dilia will also give part of her loan to her husband so that he can use it for his farming since the winter planting season is approaching. This will allow both of them to forge ahead by working honorably each day.

This loan will be used to buy pineapples, passion fruit, and seeds for farming. Dilia is a founding member of her Communal Bank and enjoys the benefits that being in a group has offered. Her dreams include buying a truck since the car that she owns is small.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, passion fruit, and seeds for her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a 33-year-old married mother of two children from Dulag, Leyte. Julie makes a living through her sari-sari (variety) store business selling various goods. Julie has been in the business for more than seven years now. Julie is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, bread and biscuits, condiments, soap and toiletries. This loan will enable Julie to augment her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Julie wants to expand her store so that it will generate more income.  She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages, bread and biscuits, condiments, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She takes care of additional members. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land to start farming. She would like to increase her sales in the future. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Wendmangda 04Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur SIBIRI MATHIAS est le représentant du groupe WENDMANGDA 04 SAPONE. Marié, il est  père d'1 enfant. L'enfant est âgé d'01an et ne va pas à l’école. Il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l'agriculture depuis plus de 25 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter  01 motopompe.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne assurer l'avenir de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Sibiri Mathias is the group representative for Wenmangda 04 Sapone. He is married and the father of a one-year-old. He has four dependents. 

He has been a farmer for more than 25 years. He buys his supplies in the neighboring villages. He would like to buy a motor pump. He will use his profits to strengthen his business. He would like to secure his family's future.

loans.use: buy one motor pump.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 42 years old. He is married with five children, aged between 3 and 12 years, four of whom go to school. 

Viateur sells foodstuffs and has been in a business for five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fish to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Naisoem's Group

texts.en: Naisoem’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Naisoem makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families,  save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Twizigame Group

texts.en:
Esperance is 42 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 3 and 24 years old, four of them go to school.

Her group is called Twizigame, which means “save us” in English. The members of the group sell different products and they have common goals to scale their business for a better future.

Esperance sells food stuffs and has been in business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soya beans, maize and beans to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more soya beans, maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Huoy's Group

texts.en: Huoy’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Huoy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Theresa, an ever-smiling young farmer who is responsible and has had to overcome many difficulties through her life. However, she has always found the strength to move forward and to keep growing in her life. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture.

She is the proud owner of a small parcel of land, on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. 

Theresa passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cows. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Theresa is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With the loan capital, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help to fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money in order to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Savong's Group

texts.en: Savong’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savong makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: May's Group

texts.en: May’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. May makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock her genge and mamalishe business.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru:
Zulaykho is 62 years old. She lives in district called Qubadiyon. Zylaykho lives with children and daughters in not big house.
   Zulaykho is engaged in agricultural activity. She grows wheat. Now, Zulaykho is preparing for planting the next crop. She applied for a loan to plant a crop, she needs to buy wheat seeds. For purchasing of sufficient amount of wheat seeds she doesn’t have enough money. Zulaykho believes that you will help her to make a purchase.
texts.en:
Zulaykho is 62 years old. She lives in a district called Qubadiyon. She lives with children and daughters in a small house. Zulaykho is engaged in agricultural activity; she grows wheat. 

Now, Zulaykho is preparing to plant the next crop. She has applied for a loan to plant a crop.  She needs to buy wheat seeds. She doesn’t have enough money to purchase a sufficient amount of wheat seeds. Zulaykho believes that you will help her to make this purchase.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds for planting a crop.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Inobat and her family lives in Qubadion district. She is 38 years old. She is married and has children. Inobat, just like many other residents of the republic, is involved in agriculture. She has been in this business for over 2 years. Her husband and mother in law primarily help her with the farming work. She is preparing to plant a new crop and requested a loan for this reason. Her main goal now is to plant crop. Inobat must buy wheat seeds. She does not have enough money to pay for this. Inobat hopes for Your help and thinks that with Your help, she will be able to complete her sowing and gather a rich harvest next season.
texts.en:
Inobat and her family live in Qubadion district. She is 38 years old, and she is married and has children. Inobat, like many other residents of the republic, is involved in agriculture. She has been in this business for over two years. Her husband and mother-in-law primarily help her with the farming work. 

She is preparing to plant a new crop and has requested a loan for this reason. Her main goal now is to plant the crop. Inobat must buy wheat seeds, but she does not have enough money to pay for this. She hopes for your help, and thinks that with your help, she will be able to complete her sowing and gather a rich harvest next season.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds for planting a new crop.

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members.

She operates a retail shop in a shop that she rents. Fiona has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour and crates of soda. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to the university level and buy a van for transporting her merchandise. Fiona lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her shop and school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour and crates of soda

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 28-year-old fish vendor from McArthur, Leyte. She is married and has been in the food vending business for more than three years now.  Marites is standing next to a bucket cooler where she stores her fish for selling.

Marites is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell. A loan will help Marites in improving her business. Marites future plans include the expansion of her fish vending business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia initially entered the retailing business by selling grocery items in her village. With the desire to improve her family's living standard, she searched for another source of income. She then came to manage a business reloading cell phones. 

Today, Celedonia also sells prepaid and postpaid loads for different cellular networks. She wants to sell cellphone accessories too, but doesn’t have enough capital to pursue it. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more prepaid loads and cellphone accessories. She hopes to increase sales and earnings and make her desire a reality.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 27 years old. He is married and has a three-year-old child who is still too young to attend school. He has been a farmer for nine years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for his rice field. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and pay his workers.

 The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice field.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 25 years old. He is not married. He has a shop and has been in a business for 4 years.

With the loan, he would like to buy flasks, lotions and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy flasks, lotions and cooking oil to resell

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 40 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 7 months and 19 years, and 3 of them go to school.

He has a mini supermarket and has been in a business for one year. With the loan, he would like to buy more milk, yoghurt, juice and bread to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more milk, yoghurt, juice and bread to resell

loans.name: Sayragul

texts.ru: Cайрагуль успешно погасила свой кредит по линии Кива, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Cайрагуль есть 2 коровы, на ежедневной основе она продает домашнее, экологически чистое и очень вкусное молоко, в день по 13 литров. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Cайрагуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Cайрагуль планирует доходы от кредита вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sayragul used her previous Kiva loan as intended and successfully paid it off.  She thanks Kiva as well as all the lenders who helped her get this financing.  Sayragul currently owns two cows.  Every day she sells 13 liters of delicious organic milk that she gets from her cows.  This activity brings her a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy an additional dairy cow, in order to produce more milk.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow in order to produce more organic milk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and a drip irrigation kit

loans.name: Creative Women Group

texts.en:
Creative women are a group of three hardworking women, who are not only business women but caring mothers who are working hard to secure their children’s futures. 

Margaret is the chairperson of the group. She is 50 years old and is a married mother of two. Margaret and her group members have been in businesses for a long time and have been taking part in Roscas together. A Rosca is an informal rotating saving and credit association. 

Margaret and her group members' businesses where struggling to grow and not giving them much profits. This was until  a year ago, when someone told them about Thrive and how it helped women grow their businesses. Margaret and her group members have since joined Thrive and their businesses have seen a marked improvement. The business training on savings and record keeping have helped them in their businesses. With her first and seconds loan from Thrive Margaret was able to expand her flea market stall and have two tables where she sells clothing. With a third loan from Thrive, Margaret hopes to open a third table and maybe one day operate from a proper shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
Rohat is a kind and responsive woman from a small district called Qubadiyon. She is 45 years old. Rohat is married and has young children. She always tries to cook a good meal and keep comfort at home. Rohat does not have higher education and she is a housewife. 
   Two years ago, Rohat started farming business. She wants earn and helps husband to provide family. 
  Now she is preparing for sowing of wheat and potatoes, so on a loan amount Rohat will buy wheat and potatoes seeds. Rohat has a hankering to plant new crop and believes that you will help her.
texts.en:
Rohat is a kind and responsible woman from a small district called Qubadiyon. She is 45 years old, and she is married and has young children. She always tries to cook a good meal and keep comfort at home. Rohat does not have higher education and she is a housewife. 

Two years ago, Rohat started a farming business. She wanted to earn and help her husband to provide for the family.  Now she is preparing for sowing wheat and potatoes. Rohat will buy wheat and potatoes seeds with her loan amount. She has a hankering to plant a new crop and believes that you will help her.

loans.use: to plant a crop of wheat and potatoes.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom are attending school. Irene is not looking after any other family members. For the past two years, she has been operating a food stall at the market where she sells green bananas. Irene works seven days a week and does not have any other source of income. Her business challenges include seasonality. Irene rents a house with both electricity and running water and her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. She joined MCDT because of the low loan interest.

Irene is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to stock more green bananas. Her dream is to buy land to start farming.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Jupita Group

texts.en: Salma is in her late 30's and single. She runs a salon business where she also sells cosmetics. She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This is her second loan request from Tujijenge Tatiana (Kiva's partner) to be apportioned among the four members of the Jupita Group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Salma managed to repay successfully her previous loan. She bought supplies of cosmetics and hair dressing items, which allowed her to earn extra income to cover her living costs. Her dream is to manage a big shop selling many beauty items. With her new loan request, she will use the money to buy up-to-date salon products and to increase the stock of cosmetics that she sells. She is so thankful with everyone who shows support for her group.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon products.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Charles, better known as "Charlo,” who is an energetic, brave, and humble man who hails from the Thika area of Kenya - an area that is very fertile and always receives plenty of rainfall. The major cash crop grown in the Thika area is potatoes, and that is why this region is nicknamed “potatoes region”. Charles is a caring father and has been farming for the past 10 years. Through farming, he has been able to take care of his children and family. Charles also does business so that he can make ends meet and increase his profit levels. Through these ventures, he has always brought food home and earned an honest living. He is a very hardworking man, and sells milk and his produce in the market and to his neighbors so that he is able to make more money. 

One challenge that he is currently facing involves getting his products to the market on time. Because of the poor road network and poor feeder roads, the products are no longer fresh when they reach the market. This means that Charles must sell them at a throw-away price, hence not getting maximum profit. Products such as milk, fruits, and vegetables require a timely delivery to market and, for this reason, Charles is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to buy a motorbike that will assist him in getting his products to market faster. He is sure of reaping more profit because his products will be fresh and will fetch more money. With improved profits, Charles will be able to assure his children of a brighter future and improve his living conditions. Having gone through and understood the repayment schedule, he is sure that he will be able to repay the loan on time and increase his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike so that he can get his produce to market faster.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in his life. However, he has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with his six lovely children. Stephen is a smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is an agricultural center near the famous Mount Kenya (the second highest in Arica). He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely 47-year-old beautiful wife, and they have been blessed with six children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 20 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a “small side hustle” to supplement the meager income they earn through farming. From Kiva lenders, Stephen is seeking a loan worth KES 20,000 to grow his horticulture business. 

Horticultural produce and processed products is becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident from the steadily rising exports. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to provide Stephen with access to a loan facility that will assist him to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Stephen’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

Lenders, kindly support this enterprising man with a loan!

loans.use: To grow his horticulture business

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 33 years old. She is married with two children ages 3 and 5 years, and one of them goes to school. She has a shop and has been in a business for seven years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy another amount of mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 37 years old. She is a widow. She has farmed for 20 years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell the rice.

loans.name: Gulaisha

texts.ru: Гулайша, 53 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Гулайшы высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она работает учителем в школе, также уже 19 лет она занимается сельским хозяйство. В хозяйстве Гулайшы есть 8 коров и 1 лошадь. На участке мерою 1,33 Га она выращивает фасоль и картофель для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Гулайшы, ее деятельность приносит около 16,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Гулайше построить сарай для скота, а в будущем - новый дом для ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulaisha is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a higher education and she works as a school teacher, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  In addition, she has been involved in agriculture for 19 years already.  She owns eight cows and one horse, and she grows beans and potatoes for resale on 1.33 hectare of land.  Thanks to her very hard work, her activity brings her a monthly income of about 16,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Gulaisha has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy 20 sheep.  The earnings from her loan will help her to build a barn for her livestock and, in the future, a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta 5 grado, es padre soltero, el creció solo a sus hijos, ahora ya están casados y el vive solo con su sobrina en su hogar.

Andrés, desde muy joven su padre le enseño a trabajar, actualmente trabaja en la alcaldía municipal 
de su domicilio,el trabajo le queda a  cinco minutos de su casa y el horario es de 8:00 A.M a 3:00 P.M.

Andrés, solicita el préstamo para comprar, cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra, porque está construyendo un muro en su casa.- Además, antes que llegue la época de invierno, quiere reparar el techo de su casa para que él y su familia estén en mejores condiciones de vida y más protegidos.

El sueño de Andrés es, arreglar poco a poco su casa para que sea una vivienda digna de ser habitada.
texts.en:
Andrés, who is 51 years old, went to school through 5th grade. He is a single father. He raised his children alone. Now they are already married, and he lives with only his niece in his home.

When Andrés was very young, his father taught him to work. Now he works in the municipal office. His work is five minutes away from his house, and his schedule is from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm.

Andrés is applying for the loan to buy cement and sand and pay for labor, because he is constructing a wall in his house. In addition, before the winter season arrives, he wants to repair the roof of his house, so that he and his family will be in better living conditions and better protected.

Andrés' dream is to repair his house little by little, so that it will be a house worthy of being inhabited.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 41 years old. He is from Bugomola LC1 in Bushenyi, and it’s where his business is located. He is a principle farmer, mainly coffee farming and a banana plantation. Wilson’s side income is cattle rearing, where he sells cows and milk and earns a lot from it. He has managed to pay school fees for his child and dependent and also meet the family needs. 

It is his fourth cycle with UGAFODE Micro finance Ltd. He is borrowing UGX.2,500,000 only to buy fertilizer for his plantations. He works for six hours a day, and most of his clients are coffee traders. He started that business sixteen years ago, and for all those years it has been very profitable. He resorted to farming after getting a chunk of land from his father as his share.

He hopes to buy a car for transporting his outputs, be it coffee, matooke, milk, and others, and later use the money to purchase another piece of land for an extension. He finds challenges of bacterial wilt and price fluctuations. He thanks Kiva lenders through UGAFODE so much for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a fearless, hard working and shrewd client from the Bugongi, Sheema District. She is married with four children and they all are in good schools. Her business is located in Bugongi's rural trading centre. She buys bales of second hand clothes that she sells at her shop and sometimes she takes them to weekly open markets. The shop is within her premises therefore she does not spend money on accommodation or rent. Her side income is agriculture and she earns a lot from it. She started her business in the year 2009 to have an income.

This is her third loan from UGAFODE microfinance ltd (MDI). She works for 6 days a week and eight hours a day. The major threat with her business is competition, because it requires a lot of money. She  has borrowed 2,000,000 UGX to buy bales of clothes for sell. She asks UGAFODE micro finance to continue supporting her business.

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothes.

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat is an honest woman. She was born in 1967 in a family of farmers. She was taught physical work from childhood. When she got married, her husband did not have work. They had serious material difficulties. Hidoyat decided to help her husband with earning money to feed the family. She worked at seasonal job, where she gained good practical work. From earned money she bought cattle. After a year she started to do a business with livestock. She worked hard. 

She has four grown up children and educated them well. Her children became accustomed to work with livestock and land. Now, Hidoyat with her husband, are working together planting agricultural products and keeping cattle. 

She is a confident woman and is supported by her husband and children. Hidoyat has a strong behavior and honest work. Her family is proud of her. She is planning to widen her activity. She needs financial support for planting agricultural products. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for sowing. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for sowing.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a 52-year-old married woman, and a mother of four grown up children from Dulag, Leyte. She is engaged in retail sales of gasoline. Rosalinda has been in the business for more than nine years now. She also earns an additional income through hog raising. Rosalinda is asking to take a loan to buy more gasoline to sell and to buy animal feed for the pigs. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her profits.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell and to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su sobrina, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, posee muchos clientes por la variedad de productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marta, age 59, lives in her own house with her niece.  She has had a small store at her house for several years.  She has a lot of customers because of the variety of products in her store.  She gets good sales from these products, and she manages to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, and sugar, etc.  She will do this in order to have better earnings and improved financial stability.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Chozvo Group 4

texts.en:
Chozvo 4 are a proud group of 12 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. 

All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. The group sells its crop at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. 

The group in total farms 15.5 hectares of land. All farming is done manually. The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs - all of them purchase seed and some choose to also purchase fertilizer. 

Access to a group loan of 30,490 Meticais equates to an average of 2,541 Meticais (79 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they need. Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertilizer, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week - they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops. Since ECA’s arrival into their community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase maize crops yields

loans.name: Raimakan

texts.ru: Раимакан 63 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Раимакан среднее образование, уже много лет она занимается разведением скота и полеводством. У Раимакан в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 3 коровы и 7 овец, также на земельном наделе 0,80 Га арендованной и 1,25 Га собственной земли, она выращивает хлопчатник и кукурузу. Раимакан очень спокойная и трудолюбивая. Ее ежемесячная прибыль с учетом пенсии составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Раимакан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Raimakan is 63 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in cattle breeding and crop farming for many years already.  She currently owns three cows and seven sheep, and she also grows cotton and corn on 0.8 hectare of leased land and 1.25 hectare of her own land.

Raimakan is a very quiet and hardworking woman.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS), including her pension.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to grow her farming business and also to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Victorienne

texts.en: Victorienne is 57 years old. She is married with five children aged between 14 and 34 years, and three of them go to school. She sells charcoal and has been in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 30 years old. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 5 years, and one of them goes to school. He sells charcoal and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is 38 years old. He is married with five children aged between two and fourteen years; three of them go to school. 

Emanuel sells metals and has been in this business for six years. With this loan, he would like to buy different metals to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car to use in his business.

loans.use: To buy different metals to resell.

loans.name: Franklin Dario

texts.es:
Franklin es un hombre de 38 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como jornalero en otras fincas y es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la adecuación de sus marraneras y la compra de cuido para sus cerdos con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá mejores cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.

Apoya a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Franklin, age 38, is a loving father and a farmer.  Seeing that his earnings are not enough to cover his household expenses, he started a business activity that he does during the time he has off from working as a day worker on other farms.  This business activity is raising and selling pigs that he fattens.  He does this in order to improve his family’s living conditions.  As head of the family, he is in charge of all of the household expenses.  Therefore, he does not have much capital left over to invest in his business.

That is the reason he needs a loan to adapt his pigsties to buy items for to care for the pigs.  With these he will be able to improve his sales and drive this business activity.  He will have more assets in his small business, which will be more attractive to his customers.  He will have better pigs to sell.

His main dream is to be able to generate good income so that his family does not go without any necessity.  It is something that happened to him, and it affected him greatly.  This is the reason that he works tirelessly for his children and his wife.

Support a farmer from rural Colombia who has big dreams for his family.

loans.use: to adapt his pigsties to buy items for to care for the pigs.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
This is the second time Shoira asks for your help. A few months ago, she took a loan for her trading business which was financially supported by Kiva lenders. She is very grateful for it because she improved her business.
 
Shoira is a polite woman and knows how to attract the attention of customers. Now she wants to increase her assortment of seasonal goods. For this reason, she is asking for a new loan. Shoira has already fully repaid her previous loan.

She believes, with support of Kiva lenders, she will be successful in her business. and in the future she will open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase women’s clothing to sell.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam who is in his late 20’s, is married.  He has been running two projects, a barbershop and a motorcycle, for one and a half years now.  He works from 9 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Islam's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle and to increase the salon products, and has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He will use this loan to buy up-to-date barbershop products to meet his customers' requests and to service his motorcycle.  He dreams of building a nice house. Islam will make sure he pays back the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date barbershop products to meet his customers' requests and to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe, age 35, is married with three children between two and eleven years old. Two of them go to school. She has been selling charcoal for nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal for resale. The profits from her sales will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 30 years old. He is not married. 

Benjamin sells clothes and has been in this business for two years. With this loan, he would like to buy more shirts and trousers to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and trousers to resell.

loans.name: Emrush

texts.en:
Emrush is 44 years old and the father of two children. He and his family live in a small village where most of the residents are involved in agriculture in order to generate an income. With his wife, Emrush plants many different vegetables on their land to harvest and sell in the market. He also has a greenhouse to be able to continue to grow in the winter season.  Although this is their main source of income, his children also help to increase their money by collecting papers. 

Now, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials to build another greenhouse to ensure an income in the winter season and to be able to produce more vegetables. Emrush loves what he does and enjoys life in the village. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build another green house to ensure an income in the winter season and to be able to produce more vegetables.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 31 years old. She is married with three children between 8 and 12 years old. All of them go to school. She is a tailor and has been in a business for 14 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring.

loans.name: Shemside

texts.en:
Shemside is 43 years old and a mother of four children. She has been involved in agricultural business for more then 14 years now. She has currently two cows, from which she sells milk and milk products at a collection point.  In this manner, she is able to earn a profit and contribute to her family. Shemside’s husband has tried several times to find a job as a second source of income, but he has never succeeded. 

The unemployment situation and economic status has been what motivated them to work hard on their farm. Now, Shemside is requesting a loan in order to purchase another milk cow to meet the demands of her customers. She is very optimistic that she will be able to continue to expand her farm and her income, providing a way for to give her children a better education and to attend school in the city. She is very grateful for the opportunity and support from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow in order to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is a 24-year-old married woman. She lives in Kutaisi district with her husband and two sons who are four and five years old. Lana's husband works as a cooker locally and earns a monthly income. 

Lana has a small plumbing shop. She needs money to purchase a stock of materials for her shop. 

The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2,000 (USD). With the received credit, Lana will purchase  plumbing materials to resell in her shop such as pipes, taps and so on. She will increase the turnover of her shop and also will be able to offer a wide assortment of products. This will give her a chance to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her plumbing shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some furniture for his house

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old, married and has three children. 

Edna is a retail store owner selling a variety of products to the people in her village. She hopes to continue improving her sales and income, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items such and cooking oil, sugar, bread, eggs, biscuits and soft-drinks to sell. 

Someday, Edna hopes to establish a larger store to display more items in her store. This will also give her better sales opportunities in her business. She will save additional funds for education and for her family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, sugar, bread, eggs, biscuits and soft-drinks to sell

loans.name: Fe Angelie

texts.en: Fe Angelie is a 26-year-old entrepreneur from Baybay, Leyte, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari store (small convenience store) where she sells items like biscuits, soft drinks, spices, detergent, soap, canned goods, corn starch, candies and shampoo. This is her way of supporting her two-year-old daughter. Fe Angelie has requested a loan of 6000 PHP to buy canned goods, toiletries, chips, seasonings and soft drinks to sell at her store. Fe Angelie hopes to engage in other business opportunities and live a comfortable life with her child in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, toiletries, chips, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elva Isabel

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Santa Teresita.
En este lugar vive la señora Elva, tiene 64 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Elva junto al esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos  tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí ellos venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, así como también carnes, legumbres, frutas, artículos de bazar y papelería, helados entre otros productos, ellos ya llevan más de diez años con este negocio el cual les permite ganarse la vida honradamente, con los créditos que reciben ya por más de seis años aumentaron mucho mas su negocio y así cada vez que siguen recibiendo los créditos compran mas variedad de productos lo cual le sirve para ganar más clientela. 
Este crédito es para comprar: víveres para surtir su tienda, helados útiles escolares, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 6 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
Ecuadorian and international tourists flock to the stunning coastal resort of San Jacinto, which features a lovely beach where the Portoviejo River meets the sea. San Jacinto is also where the Santa Teresita Credit Group meets twice a month. One of the member of the Santa Teresita group is Señora Elva, who is 64, the wife of a her business partner, and the mother of four adult children who live on their own. 

Doña Elva and her husband run a business in their home, a grocery store that offers all kinds of basic necessities as well as meat, vegetables, fruits, ice cream, convenience items and paper goods. The store has allowed Doña Elva and her husband to earn an honest living, building the business with the support of loans over six years. Each loan has allowed the couple to purchase a variety of goods that helped them attract more customers. 

This loan is for the purchase of grocery items to stock the store, such as ice cream, school supplies, and other goods that Doña Elva and her husband sell. She has been a member of the Santa Teresita Group for over six years, and is pleased with the loans she's received. Doña Elva's goal is to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, ice cream, school supplies, and other goods.

loans.name: Freddy Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Santa Teresita.
En este lugar vive la señora Freddy, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 10 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es profesor de escuela.
Doña Freddy es una muy buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para así lograr sus recursos y con estos poder salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual se dedica a la cría de pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende por libras a vecinos de sus localidad,  o entrega en el mercado a comerciantes en este lugar, con esto ella se gana lo suyo que les sirve para los estudios de sus hijos ya que los gastos son muchos y a su marido no le alcanza para todo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
The beautiful seaside town of San Jacinto is surrounded by a beautiful place. It is where the Portoviejo river unites with the sea and it is visited by many tourists, both domestic and international. Every two weeks the Santa Teresita credit group meets. 

This is where Freddy lives. She is 50 years old, married and from that relationship she has 3 children, aged 15, 12 and 10. The older ones are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a school teacher. 

Freddy is a very good wife who likes to work to obtain the resources and with these, be able to get ahead. She has a small farm where she raises chickens. She buys these animals when they are still small and raises then in a space for three or for months until they have reached a sufficient weight. Later she sells them by the pound to neighbors in the area, or she delivers them in the market to merchants there. With this, she earns her living which she uses to pay for her children's education since there are a lot of expenses and her husband can't pay for everything. 

She is going to use this loan to buy chickens, feed and medicine so they will have a good development. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes helps she is getting with the loans. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medicine for the chickens.

loans.name: Ylber

texts.en:
Ylber wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous support he was given. With the loan he received, he was able to purchase guano (fertilizer) for his land and farm. Ylber was pleased with the loan process and the results, and now is requesting a second loan in order to purchase another milk cow. 

He will be able to use the cow for his own family needs, thereby saving money and to generate more income by selling in his neighborhood. He is very confident he will see success with this loan. He has always dreamed of having a big farm. He hopes that he will be able to achieve his dream in the near future, and is grateful for the opportunity to try to attain his goals.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow.

loans.name: Yubelka Yuranela

texts.es:
Día a día la cantidad de personas que visitan un centro hospitalario en busca de ayuda incrementan, Yubelka por su parte decidió corresponder a esta demanda y dedicarse al estudio de enfermería para asistir a las personas con dificultades físicas y con mayor necesidad. A sus 27 años de edad cursa el 4to año de la carrera, su mayor sueño es obtener su título de graduación para ejercer un trabajo con más finalidad. Solicita préstamo para cubrir el costo de los módulos de finalización de la carrera.
Después de obtener su título, Yubelka planea Prestar sus servicios a la comunidad, clínicas y hospitales  y así conseguir la retribución de un buen salario. De igual manera pretende iniciar una especialización en su carrera que le permita desarrollar sus conocimientos como profesional y que le permita también dirigirse hacia nuevos horizontes.
texts.en:
Day by day the amount of people that visit a hospital to get help is increasing. Yubelka for her part decided to reply to this demand studying nursing to help people with physical difficulties and those with great need. At 27 years old she is in her 4th year of her course. Her big dream is to obtain her graduation certificate so she can do her work with more purpose.

She is requesting this loan to cover the costs of the final courses of her studies. After getting her certificate Yubelka plans to offer her services to the community, clinics and hospitals and thus get remuneration in a good salary. At the same time she plans to start to specialize in her profession which will allow her to develop her knowledge as a professional and allow her to reach towards new horizons.

loans.use: to cover the cost of the final courses of her studies.

loans.name: Blanca Yessenia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 38 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos de 15, 8 y 1 año de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es mecánico.
Doña Blanca es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos tanto del hogar y de los estudios se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa y productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella aprovecha sus ratos libres para salir a vender aunque también vende en la universidad en la cual estudia, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 5  años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo para el bien familiar.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 2 ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Amigas Trabajadoras" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place known for the great variety of sweets prepared here and known on a national level for their delicious taste.

Blanca lives here. She is 38 years old, is in a common-law relationship and from this relationship she has 3 children aged 15, 8 and 1 year old. The older ones study in schools. Her husband is a mechanic.

Blanca is a housewife, who in order to have her own resources and with them be able to help her husband with the household and educational expenses, is in business. She sells clothing and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). Her method of selling is door-to-door and she takes advantage of her spare time to get out and sell. She also sells at the university where she studied. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days. She has been in the business for 5 years which allows her to make her own money for the good of the family.

This loan is to buy clothing, perfume, creams and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles and she likes it as the loans helped her start her business. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Begimai

texts.en:
Begimai is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is her story:

“I set a goal to study at AUCA a long time ago and my parents have always supported me in all my endeavors. I strongly believe that from my further education depend not only my career, but also my future life. I find AUCA a place, where I can get a good knowledge and skills that I can use in the future. The fact is that, the good education costs good/much money, and my family isn’t able to provide it.

We are six people in my family: my parents, me,  two younger sisters and my younger brother.  My sisters go to school and brother visit kindergarten. My both parents are public servants with the small salary, which is rarely enough for our daily necessities. As I am the eldest daughter, they try to give me everything, what will help me in this life, one of these important things is an education, but only the good one. Being well educated means for me a stable job, good salary, and friendly society, realizing plans and being able to help others.

As said above, my parent’s salary is the only source of our income. Several months ago my father was fired from his old job and thanks to God, was able to find a new one, but with the less salary. 
I always wanted my parents be proud of me: I was a diligent student at school, visited training courses TOEFL to pass the entrance exams, participated in the “Brain Ring” competition in order to get a full scholarship at AUCA. Unfortunately, I was one of 12 finalists. Then I tried to get high scores at National Testing to study for free at AUCA, but was lack of 4 points, that disappointed me a lot. I think the last chance to pay for my AUCA tuition is to get a Kiva loan. And hope that this time I will be successful.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Soklorn

texts.en: Soklorn is a 20-year-old single student who majors in banking and finance in the fourth year at university. She lives in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. She has also worked as a cashier at a company since 2014, making approximately 7.33 USD each day. Because Soklorn doesn’t have enough money to pay her fourth-year tuition fees, she would like to request a loan. This is her second loan cycle. With this loan, she will graduate with skills for her future favorite job. In the future, she wants to work for a bank with a good salary so she will be able to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her fourth-year tuition fees.

loans.name: Emmelienne

texts.en:
Emmelienne is 32 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of five and 12 years old. She has a shop and has been in business for five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, biscuits and soap to resell at her shop. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, biscuits and soap to resell at her shop.

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años, y su negocio es una librería.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable  y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘el torno’ una comunidad campesina ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad en automóvil, caracterizada por el comercio agrícola que reúne a compradores de la ciudad y vendedores del campo, el clima del lugar es tropical con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Yolanda es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio que realiza (de pie, usa blusa rosa). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al autotransporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa de la familia que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería, como; lápices, bolígrafos, cuadernos, hojas blancas, papel de colores, reglas, marcadores, etc. Labor que realiza durante todo el día de lunes a sábado, los domingos se dedica a su familia; realizando paseos, y limpieza del hogar. Su librería tiene ventas constantes debido a que se encuentra cerca de un colegio, las ventas bajan en época de vacaciones, utilizando esas fechas para realizar el inventario y reposición de los materiales faltantes. “la librería en época de clases no para de vender, en época de vacaciones es un poco vacía, ese es buen momento para realizar el inventario…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una cadena de librerías. Ella desea abastecer su librería con material escolar como libros, textos escolares, cuentos, cuadernos y otros, para recibir el nuevo año escolar preparada con todos los materiales necesarios. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yolanda solicita un préstamo para la compra de material escolar para abastecer su librería para el nuevo año escolar.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 28, lives with her life partner.  She has two children, ages nine and two.  Her business is a book store.

She is a good mother, independent, enterprising, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible and hard-working.  She conducts her business in the El Torno area, a rural community that is a 45 minute car ride from the city.  It is known for its agricultural commerce, which gets together buyers from the city and sellers from the fields.  The place has a tropical climate with a constant temperature of 30 degrees centigrade all year.

Yolanda has a dark complexion, is short, and has long black hair.  Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the business she does.  (She is standing and has on a pink blouse.)  She shares her life with her life partner, who works in transportation, and her children, who go to school.  They live in the family house that has well water and electricity.

Her business is selling bookstore items like pencils, pens, notebooks, white paper, colored paper, rulers, and markers, etc.  She works all day from Monday through Saturday.  She devotes Sundays to her family by taking walks and cleaning house.

Her bookstore has constant sales because it is close to a school.  Sales drop during vacations.  She uses this time to take inventory and replace needed materials.  “During the school season the bookstore does not stop selling.  During vacations it is a little empty.  This is a good time to take inventory,” she says.

Her dream is to have a chain of bookstores.  She wishes to stock her bookstore with school materials like books, school texts, stories, notebooks, and others.  She wants to do this in order to be prepared with the needed materials for the new school year.

This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the first year that she has been engaged in this business activity.  It is for these reasons that Yolanda is requesting a loan to buy school materials to stock her bookstore for the new school year.

loans.use: to buy school materials to stock her bookstore for the new school year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock wholesale, including pastries, dairy products, cookies, and grains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to further expand her business.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad, soltero

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operario de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansado de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de salir adelante, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección, para lo cual se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una maquina fileteadora, recubridora e insumos de confección como tela e hilos. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado. 

Con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo siempre de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Andres is a 21 year old entrepreneur. He is single. 

During his productive life, he has worked in different sewing workshops as a machine operator. That is why he has experience and knowledge about the management of this type of business. But now he is tired of working in other workshops and he is eager to get ahead. He has decided to start his own sewing workshop. That is why he decided to ask for a loan which will be invested in buying an overlock machine, a serger and sewing materials such as fabric and thread.  

This will allow him to begin his productive project with which he hopes to make a good impact in the sector to generate favorable profits and thus make his dream come true of having a position in the market. 

With his drive and ambition, he is projecting for the medium term to generate employment, always hand in hand with Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, a serger, and sewing materials such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking young man who juggles several jobs to make ends meet. He recently completed his ordinary level studies, but missed the chance to join high school the previous year because he was still saving for tuition.

Even though he works as a cleaner, he has always admired people who have gone to school, especially those in the bank where he works. He wants to speak English and learn to use the computer like they do. He aspires to attain at least a degree because he has registered a cleaning company, of which he is the director. Francis is a very innovative and hardworking young man. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Chozvo Group 5

texts.en:
Chozvo 5 are a proud group of 11 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. The group sells its crop at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. 

An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. The group in total farms 12.5 hectares of land. 

All farming is done manually. The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs - all of them purchase seed and some choose to also purchase fertilizer. 

Access to a group loan of 21,590 Meticais (677 USD) equates to an average of 1,963 Meticais (62 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they need. Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertilizer, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week - they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops. Since ECA’s arrival into their community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase maize crops yields

loans.name: Nokuthula Group

texts.en:
The Nokuthula group, which names derived from a Ndebele word meaning “peace”, is made up of five hardworking women who desire to improve their living standards of their families as well as attaining financial security through investing in their small businesses. They need a combined loan of $2000, which will be invested in their small businesses of tailoring, poultry, and cross-boarder trading.

Natsai is a member of this group and is married with three school-going children. She is a talented tailor who has been in the business for the past three years specializing in interior decor. Over the years she has managed to increase her client base composed of from motels and lodges tenders to who she supplies curtains, sheets and pillow cases. Natsai hopes to open a décor shop in Harare Central Business District, selling products she sews as well as cosmetics.  

A Kiva loan will help the Nokuthula group to increase their capital base.

loans.use: to expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alije

texts.en:
Alije is 49 years old, a Roma woman, who is the mother of five children. For more than ten years, she has been involved in agriculture, planting different types of vegetables to sell in the market, such as potatoes, tomatoes, etc. Although her husband works for an electrical company, he makes a low salary and Alije works hard to be able to contribute to the family’s income. She is very proud to have the ability to assist in providing for her family and doing something independent. 

Now, for the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a greenhouse, so that she can continue to plant and harvest during the winter months and continue to generate income. She loves what she does and is happy to be able to assist her family. She would like to be able to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greenhouse so that she can continue to plant and harvest during the winter months.

loans.name: Tinashe Group

texts.en:
Being the chairlady of a women’s group needs you to be reliable, mature, have discretion and accountability as your character traits. That is what the women of Tinashe group saw in their chairlady Beauty. Beauty is a married mother of 2 school-going children. Tired of just sitting idle at home, Beauty started a small business 2 years ago. She started a cross-boarder trading business and peanut butter business. She crosses the border into neighboring South Africa buying clothing, bedding and kitchen ware for resale. She also procures nuts and processes them into peanut butter. 

Her business has managed to help improve their standard of living as they now do not only look to one source of income as a family. With her loan from Thrive, Beauty wants to cross the border to procure wares for resale and she also wants to work hard and buy her own peanut butter machine so that her production costs are reduced increasing her profits.

loans.use: to buy a peanut butter making machine to bring her costs down.

loans.name: Free Evangelicals Group

texts.en:
Mary is a mother of five, a wife, and an entrepreneur. She also is a member and treasurer of the Free Evangelicals group based in Kambuzuma High Density Suburb in Harare. Mary is a cross-border trader who also bakes cakes to order. Mary and her group members joined Thrive so as to grow their businesses. They are in their second loan cycle with Thrive. With her 1st loan Thrive Mary bought footwear and clothing and blankets for her flea market stall. 

Mary’s children are all still school going with the oldest at University, hence the need to work hard and complement her husband’s income. The challenges she faces in business are when people delay or refuse to pay money after they buy from her on credit. With her current loan Mary wants to open another flea market in the Central Business District of Harare where there is a wider market base. In future she also has dreams of opening a small baking school and training young people to bake.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale and to expand her bakery.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children. She takes care of one additional family member. For the past three years, she has been selling goats from home. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO (Kiva's partner) to buy more breeds of goats. Her goal and aspiration is to diversify to poultry farming. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more breeds of goats.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
This is Zahra, a 32-year-old hard working Lebanese married mother of two. She has run her convenience store since 1998, and is working hard to develop it into a well known supermarket in the future, to make sure she can develop her family's standard of living in a well managed way.

Her husband works in the construction and the agriculture businesses upon request. Their combined income is barely enough to cover their living needs.
