She also can't invest her earned income in increasing her business merchandise, but she works hard on diversifying her products as much as she can to reply to customers' needs. She is working hard to search for good quality products with special offers that will attract more customers, increase her income and, at the same time, she can afford to buy them. However, Zahra needs a means of transportation to go and search for better resources. For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. 

Zahra will use the loan to buy a pickup that she will use for searching for a wider market, with encouraging wholesale prices to increase her business merchandise properly. She will also let her son develop his aluminum business through transporting his tools, machines and necessary equipments instead of renting others cars. The pickup will have a double impact for her and her son's businesses, and will reflect a positive spirit in their beloved family.

She hopes that she can stay capable of supporting her beloved family.

loans.use: to buy a pickup that she will use to develop her business, and to help her son develop his aluminum business.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is single with one child. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes by selling door to door and has been in this business for one year. 

Ritah has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes for resale. She works at the market seven days every week and sells on a retail basis only. She would like to get permanent business premises. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Leyte is the province in the Philippines famous for its coconut wine. A CEVI client named Rosalita comes from this place. She is 36 years old and married with five children between the ages of three and 15 years old. 

Rosalita relies on gathering coconut wine for an income. This has been her business for 15 years, earning her 4,500 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy tannin powder and plastic containers. Tannin powder is a reddish food color mixed into coconut wine. 

She hopes to expand her business to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy tannin powder and plastic containers.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio used the previous loan to buy eggs to sell. Emilio is 43 years old, male, and married with eight children, living In Kasese, Uganda. Emilio sells eggs. He also does farming, growing crops such as maize, beans, peas and other food to increase his income. 

Emilio has a dream of being the greatest supplier of eggs in his area. However, he is faced with the challenge of  limited capital and damages. Emilio wants a loan to buy more crates of eggs to enable his business to move on well.

loans.use: to buy crates of eggs.

loans.name: Harris

texts.en:
Harris is 20 years old and is from Rizal, Nueva Ecija. His family makes a living from farming and they earn their income only during the harvest season, which makes it hard for his parents to make ends meet. 

To help lessen his parent’s burden, Harris wants to obtain for himself an education loan of 15,000 PHP from the Kiva lenders. He will use the loan to support his schooling. He wants to finish his studies in order to help lift his family out of poverty and give them a comfortable life.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en:
This group, called Tsuishitoo Group, is made up of five women and will begin its seventh loan cycle from ID-Ghana. The members of the group run a variety of businesses including the sale of soft drinks (assorted), detergents, diapers, plastics bowls and charcoal. The loan that they will take will benefit small micro-business owners like Edwina, who has a business selling soft drinks (assorted).

Edwina says that she joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She explains that she started this business after seeing a friend who was selling these products, obtain capital from ID-Ghana to establish her own independent business. The loan she will now take is to increase her capital for the purchase of assorted soft drinks from the wholesalers in the city of Accra. She will then sell them in kiosks in her neighborhood. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married with two children.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responds that she likes the savings and the institution's heath-related offerings. The group needs a total amount of GHS 7,000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase assorted soft drinks from wholesalers in the city of Accra.

loans.name: Dromo Naa Group

texts.en:
This group, called Dromo Naa Group, is made up of six women and will begin its 13th loan cycle from ID Ghana. The members of the group run a variety of businesses, including the sale of soft drinks (assorted), groundnuts, maize, tea and bread, vegetables, foodstuffs, frozen chicken, cow legs, fish and grocery. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-business owners like Sella, who has a business selling groundnuts and maize. She says that she joined ID Ghana seven years ago at the invitation of a family member who is a member of the institution. She explains that she started this business after seeing a mother who was selling these products and obtaining capital from ID Ghana to establish her own independent business. 

The loan she will take now is to increase her capital for the purchase of more maize and groundnuts from a wholesaler, which she will acquire at the market in the city of Accra. She will then sell them in another small market. This way of working allows her to generate resources to invest back in her business. When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, she responds that she likes the savings and the institution's heath-related offerings. The group needs a total amount of GHS 6,300 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more maize and groundnuts at wholesale

loans.name: Cobline Group

texts.en:
Cobline is a group of four enterprising, hardworking women based in Kuwadzana 1 High Density surburb in Harare. Pamphilia is member of this group. She is a 35 year old, married mother of 4 children. Pamphilia has a pre-school which she started operating in August 2014. Currently she has an enrollment of 35 children and she is aspiring to raise that number. She started buying items like chairs, toys and stationery until she accumulated enough assets. 

Pamphilia and her group members joined the Thrive programme so as to bolster their businesses and make them stronger and more sustainable. With her current loan from Thrive she is planning on adding more mattresses, tables and chairs for her pre-school to create a better learning environment for her beloved young students. She is grateful for the business training she got from Thrive as it has taught her to run her business at a more professional level. In future Pamphilia has plans to grow her pre-school into a junior learning centre.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her pre-school.

loans.name: Chozvo Group 6

texts.en:
Chozvo 6 are a proud group of 8 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. The group sells its crop at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. 

The group in total farms 11.5 hectares of land. All farming is done manually. 

The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs - all of them purchase seed and some choose to also purchase fertilizer. Access to a group loan of 21,250 Meticais (659 USD) equates to an average of 2,656 Meticais (82 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they need. Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertilizer, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week - they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops. Since ECA’s arrival into their community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase maize crops yields

loans.name: Artiola

texts.en:
Artiola is single, living with her parents in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. In order to earn a living, she works as a seamstress along with her mother. 

Artiola has been fortunate enough to gain all of her experience from her mother when she was younger and now they have been able to become partners in a business, making different clothing for all sorts of styles and clients, primarily focusing on dresses for special occasions. They are very popular in the area and known for their quality and professionalism. 

Because her mother also works as a cleaner for a private employer, Artiola works hard to meet customer demands in a short period of time. Now, for the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine and material for her work. She knows that this equipment will be a worthy investment as it will allow her to produce higher quality products. 

She is working on saving for her future and is very happy for the opportunity from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and material for her work.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a sales superstar!  She began working as a sales agent for iSmart and is now selling clean cookstoves and other products in informal settlements in Nairobi.  Francisca's loan will help her bring green and clean-energy products to low-income families living in Nairobi's slums. The cookstoves she sells reduce fuel consumption by half, saving her customers money and also saving trees.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in Nairobi's slum communities.

loans.name: Valdrim

texts.en:
Valdrim is 20 years old and single, living with his parents in the southern part of Kosovo. He is very hard working and does a lot in order to provide for his family. Not only does he work for a low salary as a butcher, but he also does some contract work after hours as mobile butcher when someone needs his services. 

Valdrim,is requesting a loan in order to purchase a table and knife to replace his old ones. The new equipment will help him be able to provide better services and remain in business. His goal is to be able to open his own butcher shop in the future. 

He promises to pay on time and thanks all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a new table and knife for his business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Psychology. Here is her story:

“I am applying for a Kiva loan, which, as a part of financial aid from AUCA, will help me to pursue a degree at AUCA. I believe that my good academic record and volunteer service work make me a good candidate for this loan. During my high school studies, I maintained a good level of academic achievement and also I have done volunteering service within my school. I was an active participant of a fundraising campaign for the support of orphaned and handicapped children. This commitment is very significant for me as it provides me with the incentive of being part of the support process, as well as helping me to grow personally in terms of moral ethics. 

As the economy of Tajikistan is very weak and the unemployment rate is so high, salaries are so small. My family’s total income is 4,020 USD per year, which is hardly enough to support five members of my family. This amount is the sum of my parent’s income, an unbelievable sum for the other countries. We do not spend a lot of money on entertainment and don’t allow extra stuff for ourselves; we just buy food and clothing and pay for medical expenses and utilities. 

Understanding the difficult situation of my family, I need a Kiva loan. It is a great chance for me to put an end to the uncertainty and to start a new life after my university days. Being confident in my future, I will be able to support my family and promote the well-being of my Motherland.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education fees.

loans.name: Kukataa Unyonge Group

texts.en: Luhanga is a 39 years old member of Group Kukataa Unyonge. Chukka Anyone is a part of ERDO's Wezesha Project in the city of Uvira in the Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. She has a large family and her husband is unempoyed.This is her 4th loan from Wezesha Project. Her business is located in a very competitive area of the city and she sells a variety of clothes for men, women, and children. She will use her portion of this $950 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her goal for her business is to have a permanent location within the next 5 years, but for now she continues to vary slightly from day to day. She plans to use her increased profits to pay school fees for her children and reinvest to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sales

loans.name: Zeka Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Agusta, a member of Zeka Women Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 to benefit from training in enterprise management. She is fifty-two years old, married and blessed with eight children.

She operates a green grocer as her economic activity and also does vegetable and dairy farming. She is borrowing a loan to buy more stock of onions, kale, oranges and mangoes for her grocery. This will help improve sales, thus bringing more income to sustain her family needs such as food and clothing.

She is happy with Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions, kale, oranges and mangoes to help improve sales.

loans.name: Jirani Ni Ngugu Group

texts.en: Jirani ni Ndugu is a group from Wezesha Project in the Easten Democratic Republic of Congo in the city of Uvira. Riziki is a member of this group. She is 40 years old, married mother of four children. She is the president of her lending group and ensures that each member works hard and invest their loans wisely into their businesses. Riziki is asking for a loan of $150 to buy more flashlights for sale. In Uvira, the majority of the city is without power, so many people use flashlights as an alternative to kerosene lamps, which can be both expensive and a health hazard. With her profits Riziki wants to rehabilitate her house, because her husband cannot provide the money to do so, he is unemployed. Also she would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of flashlights for sale

loans.name: Hamamaoko Group

texts.en:
Judith is a cross-boarder trader working together with her husband who is a bus driver. Living in Southerton Suburb of Harare, she has managed to unite with her friends and form a group called Hamamaoko (meaning "your hands are your relatives"). Working in this group, they managed to get training from Thrive before being given a loan. 

She is a mother of three children, two daughters and one son. She started her business of cross-boarder trading in 2004. She sells curtains, comforters, and duvets in Beira, restocking from Harare. She got her first loan of $400 in February 2014 and a second loan of $650 in June 2014. She has managed to keep her business running; generating a monthly income averaging $530. With this business, she has succeeded in paying school fees for her daughter at University and in buying a residential stand. With a loan of $800, she is planning to supply more goods to Beira in Mozambique

loans.use: to supply more goods in Beira, Mozambique.

loans.name: Maura Maria

texts.es: Doña Maura inicio hace 23 años el negocio de costura con la idea de superarse y darse un nivel de vida mejor y para cuidar a sus hijos, empezó con la ayuda de su suegra quien era costurera y así poco a poco fue aprendiendo. Tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes. Este negocio le ha ayudado a suplantar las necesidades con los ingresos obtenidos. Solicita el crédito para comprar telas de diferentes estilos y materia prima necesaria para realizar sus trajes. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Maura started her sewing business 23 years ago with the hope of moving forward, improving her quality of life, and taking care of her children. She started with the help of her mother-in-law, who was a seamstress. She learned little by little. 

Maura is 49 years old. She is married and has three children, who are now independent. This business has helped her meet her necessities by providing her with an income.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics of different styles as well as the basic materials she needs to make her garments. Among her future plans, she wishes to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy fabrics of different styles as well as the basic materials she needs to make her garments.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaiuni is a single mother of one child. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for two years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy rollers, weaves, braids, relaxers and treatments for her business. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked salon and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy rollers, weaves, braids, relaxers and treatments for her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is from Baybay, Leyte. She is 50 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 15 and 24 years old. 

Zenaida's husband works in construction services to provide for the family. She helps him by selling home-cooked snacks like puto (steamed rice cakes) and bibingka (baked rice cakes). Zenaida has had her business for ten years now. She is earning an average income of 6,000 PHP from this business. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy rice, sugar and coconuts. With the available ingredients, she can increase her production as well as her income.

In the future, she hopes to save and expand her business so she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and coconuts.

loans.name: Evelyn Elizabeth

texts.es: Evelyn de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Evelyn, who is 30 years old, lives in her own house with her life companion and their two children. She has had a little store located in her place of residence for 6 years. She has many customers because of the good prices and the friendliness that she has at the time of sale. She is applying for a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc. for her store

loans.name: Tamari

texts.en:
Tamari is 45 years old and a hardworking woman from the village of Tandzia. She has a husband and a school-aged son and daughter. The family earns a living with an agricultural business. They generate income from selling fruits and vegetables seasonally and also trading with dairy products. Tamari's husband also gets a salary of 400 GEL from another business. However, the family finds it hard to find financial stability and requested a loan for starting an additional business. 

Tamari decided to go to Turkey with the requested loan amount and purchase stock of various home products and clothing at wholesale prices, and then sell in her community at increased prices. She received the loan in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - the Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

She is very enthusiastic and a hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her children get a good education for progressing in life. This loan will be a great support for the family. Tamari is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: to start a trading business with various home products and clothing.

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Monica, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. Monica is married and is a mother to three children, known by her community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Monica joined One Acre Fund in 2011, because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Monica plans to send her children to school.

Among the 11 farmers in Monica's Group, a total of 5.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan.  Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer in order to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne is 45 years old and has ten children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Carolyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for years, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Carolyne also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Carolyne's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a young man with a bright future and a knack for sales. He's working for iSmart Kenya as a salesman where he sells green products like solar lamps and clean cookstoves door-to-door in Nairobi's slum communities. He wants to earn a living so that he can be self-sufficient and help support his family. Eventually, he would like to move up in the company to a management position. Samson believes that hard work is the key to his success. Please support him so that he can purchase products to sell and earn an honest living.

loans.use: to pay for clean energy cookstoves to sell in Nairobi's slums.

loans.name: Ana Bernardina

texts.es:
Ana es una señora que vive sola con sus hijos, uno de 24 años y el otro de 15 años, tiene 43 años de edad, viven  en una comunidad de Santo Tomas la Unión.

Ana a pesar de su edad, pues con mucho esfuerzo trabaja para generar sus ingresos,  ella es una madre muy comprometida  y responsable con sus hijos, ella trabaja como empleada doméstica, en una familia ahí en su comunidad. Pues con  este trabajo apoya  a sus hijos, el primer hijo trabaja y el segundo aun estudia. Pues con sus hijos se dieron cuenta que la casa en donde vive esta bastante deteriorada, a raíz de esta necesidad ellos deciden buscar un prestamo para  remodelarla, pero con sus ingresos no es suficiente realizar este proyecto.
 
Ana además de ser empleada doméstica, también se dedica a vender panes por las tardes, pues el interés de doña Ana es la prosperidad de sus hijos. Pues ella manifiesta que para lograr las metas  es necesario limitarse de algunas cosas, para lograr otras siempre y cuando en beneficio de la familia. Ana tiene esperanzas de conseguir esta cantidad que tanto lo necesita que son dos mil quinientos quetzales.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who lives alone with her sons, 24 and 15.  She is 43 years old and they live in the community of Santo Tomas la Union.
Despite her age, Ana works with all her might to generate income.  She is a dedicated and responsible mother to her sons.  She works as a domestic for a family in her community.  With this work, she supports her sons.  The older one works and the younger one studies.  She and her sons realized that the house where they live was pretty deteriorated so based on this necessity they decided to seek a loan to remodel it since their incomes were insufficient to carry out this project.
In addition to being a domestic, Ana makes a living selling breads in the afternoon since her interest is in the prosperity of her sons.  She demonstrates that to achieve goals it is necessary to put limits on some things in order to reach others, especially for the benefit of the family.  Ana hopes the obtain the quantity that she needs so much which amounts to 2500 quetzals.

loans.use: to remodel her residence.

loans.name: Superstar Salesmen George And Titus Group

texts.en:
George and Titus are working as door-to-door sales agents for iSmart Kenya. They've been employed for several months and have had really positive experiences. At a recent celebration, George spoke about his experience at iSmart and said, “Our lives have changed. iSmart gives you an opportunity to grow yourself, because when you come to iSmart, you have a reason to wake up in the morning.” 

George and Titus are leaders among the sales agents, inspiring new agents with their dedication and positive attitudes. Each morning they attend a morning sales meeting at 8 am and then spend their days going door-to-door selling products like solar lamps and clean-burning cookstoves throughout their community. Please help George and Titus by funding this Kiva loan so that they can continue to support themselves selling green products and earning an honest living.

loans.use: to pay for green products to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a women trying to earn a living and support her family. She works as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya selling green products like clean-burning cookstoves and solar lamps in Nairobi's slums. She has a positive attitude and connects well with customers. Her best selling product is the clean-burning cookstove which uses half the charcoal of a traditional cookstove. This saves customers money and they are eager to buy. Please help Purity fund this Kiva loan to purchase more products so that she can continue to sell in 2015 and beyond.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in Nairobi's slums.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith attended iSmart's free community training on sales and marketing and is now working as a sales agent. Each day she attends a morning sales meeting at 8am and then spends her day selling door-to-door in Nairobi's slums. Judith sells green products like solar lamps and clean-burning cookstoves that can benefit her community. Please support Judith in her quest to earn an income and be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to pay for clean energy cookstoves to sell in her community in Kenya.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a salesman working for iSmart Kenya. He signed up to attend one of iSmart's free community trainings on sales and marketing and decided that he would give it a shot. Now he earns a living selling green products like solar lamps and clean-burning cookstoves in slums around Nairobi.  li shows up every morning at 8 am for a morning sales meeting and then spends his day selling door-to-door around Nairobi. He's learned a lot about sales and hopes to continue to grow his sales in the next year.

loans.use: to pay for clean-energy cookstoves to sell in slum communities around Nairobi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean energy products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is smiling and showing off a clean cookstove that she sells door-to-door in Nairobi's slums. These cookstoves practically sell themselves as they cut fuel consumption in half. Using less fuel means less money for her customers. For low-income families, the money they save with a clean-burning cookstove can be used on other critical needs such as food, school fees or healthcare costs. Support Maureen with a Kiva loan and help her bring these products to families in need throughout Nairobi.

loans.use: to pay for cleanenergy cookstoves to sell in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Benka Group

texts.fr:
Djé is a 50 year-old married woman from Mali. Her husband is a farmer. She did not have the chance to go to school. She is the mother of 4 kids aged 4-15, of whom 2 are going to school.

Djé sells millet and peanuts and also rears sheep. She has been in this business for 10 years. With a loan from RMCR, she will be able to restock and to grow her business. She purchases at wholesale at a local market.

The profits will be used to provide for her family's needs, and to pay for food, clothing and school fees. Her dream is to have a large farm.

She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and rear sheep to resell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a 43-year-old married rice farmer with three children who lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 1987. Her husband is a 43-year-old construction worker and her three children are also constructions workers. All of them can make around 24 USD a day. 

To help her children, Touch has decided to get a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work. This loan will help her have enough money to buy her children a motorcycle. Regarding her future plans, she wants her children to do motorcycle repair courses and to save money to build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Elsa Guadalupe

texts.es: Elsa de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica desde hace 30 años a la elaboración y venta de dulces artesanales, de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su hija logran salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra materiales para la elaboración de los dulces como: cocos, azúcar, colorantes de sabores, leche, maní, etc. todo por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Elsa, who is 56 years old, lives in her own home with her daughter, who works and helps her economically. She has worked for 30 years in the elaboration and sale of artisanal candy. She is a street vendor in several markets. With the profits she obtains and the help from her daughter, they manage to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy materials to make the candy, such as: coconuts, sugar, colorings of different flavors, milk, peanuts, etc., at wholesale, to be able to keep working and therefore have better income.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts, sugar, colorings of different flavors, milk, peanuts, etc., at wholesale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a responsible mother who aims to lift her family out of poverty. She manages a store for income while her spouse is a tricycle driver and a farmer. In her store, she sells grocery items to the people in her village. She wants to improve her sales and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, bread, eggs, soft drinks and soap to sell. She wants to keep selling good products to satisfy her customers' needs and increase her profits as well.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, and soft drinks and autoload for her load retailing business

loans.name: Manal** Group

texts.en:
Manal** group comprises five  woman who are friends and neighbors. They live in different parts of Hodeida city, Yemen, a hot climate area noted for its beautiful sea. The members are friendly, kind and generous people who charm visitors. 

The leader of the group is Manal, a 20-year-old single secondary school student. Manal's family lives in very difficult conditions, and the house where Manal and her parents live lacks many housewares. As well, her father's income is not enough to cover her school fees. 

Manal has requested a loan of 50,000 Yemeni Rails (YER) from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary housewares for the house. In the future, she hopes to provide her house with new home appliances.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary housewares

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Juana inicio su negocio de cafetín hace 20 años, decidió ponerlo para tener un futuro mejor y poder de esta manera criar a sus 12 hijos y apoyarlos en todas las etapas de su vida. Tiene 59 años de edad y gracias a sus esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante en todo lo propuesto. Esta vez solicita un crédito para compra de café, cremora, azúcar, pan, chiverías. Y así  mejorar el servicio a sus clientes y poder aumentar sus ventas obteniendo buenas ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en:
Juana started her coffee stand business 20 years ago. She decided to open this business in order to have a better future and to have a way to raise her 12 children, supporting them at all stages of their lives. She is 59 years old, and as a result of her efforts, she has been able to move forward with her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy coffee, Cremora, sugar, bread, and snacks in order to offer her customers a better service and to increase her sales, obtaining good earnings. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her stand.

loans.use: to buy coffee, Cremora, sugar, bread, and snacks.

loans.name: Lendi Beatriz

texts.es:
Lendi es una mujer que trabaja en beneficio de su familia, ella es casada tiene 27 años, vive una comunidad de Santo Tomas la Unión tiene dos hijos pequeños de 7 años y un año. 

Lendi con el propósito de apoyar a su esposo para complementar los gastos de su hogar,  hace un año empezó como actividad la venta de comida, este trabajo no lo realiza todos los días únicamente vende de 2 a 3 días por semana, ella es vendedora ambulante  en el mercado de su comunidad. Y los días que no vende se ocupa en lavar ropa y hacer todo lo necesario para que su casa este limpia. 

Lendi es una madre que quiere mucho a sus hijos, y los cuida para que no se enfermen, pero el problema está en que ella no cuenta con un baño más apropiado,  donde sus hijos puedan bañarse para estar higiénicos.
  Pues con esta necesidad ella toca las puertas de ADICLA para buscar un prestamo, que le servirá  para construcción de su baño. Lendi quiere este año empezar a construir su baño que tanto ha deseado y que el prestamo va pagando poco a poco. La meta de Lendi es tener su baño y terminar de construir su casa y en un futuro tener una actividad más formal  para generar mejores ingresos ella sueño tener  una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lendi is a woman who works for the benefit of her family.  She is married and 27 years old.  She lives in the community of Santo Tomas la Union.  She has two small children, 7 and 1.  
With the objective of supporting her husband with the household expenses, a year ago Lendi began selling food.  She does not do this every day, only two or three days a week.  She is a itinerant seller in the community market.  On the days when she is not selling, she washes clothes and does everything necessary to keep her house clean.
Lendi is a mother who loves her children dearly and cares for them so they don't get sick, but the problem is that she doesn't have a very appropriate bathroom where her children can bathe in order to be hygienic.
So with this necessity, she knocked on the doors of ADICLA to seek a loan which she could use for the construction of her bathroom.  Lendi wishes to begin construction on her bathroom which she has wanted so badly this year and which the loan will pay for little by little.  Lendi's goals are to have her bathroom, to finish constructing her house, and in the future to have a more formal activity to generate income.  She dreams of having a grocery store.

loans.use: to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Camila

texts.en: Camila lives in Baybay with her family. She has four children, two of whom are still dependents and are 12 and 18 years old. Camila's husband works as a hollow block maker. She helps him meet the needs of their family by selling Avon products such as body lotion, body talc, and perfume and raising hogs for an income. Camila would like to expand her business but has limited means to do so. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy feed, supplements, piglets and rice for consumption. Camila is confident that a loan will help her business become more profitable. Her income goes towards food and reinvestment in the same business. Camila hopes to live life in abundance. She is 44 years old.

loans.use: to buy feed, supplements, piglets and rice

loans.name: Kry's Group

texts.en: Kry’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Kry makes a living cultivating rice and he also works as nurse to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: By's Group

texts.en: By’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. By makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda raises hogs for a living. It is quite a challenge because she needs to wait four months before she can see her income from her pigs. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more feed, piglets, rice and groceries. This is her way to maximize the time and increase profitability. Her income will help pay for the school fees of her children who are 2, 9 and 17 years old.  This business also allows her to be a better spouse, supporting her husband who is a potpot driver. A potpot is a bicycle with an attached sidecar and third wheel, for transporting passengers.
 
She and her family live in Baybay, Leyte.

loans.use: to buy more feed, piglets, rice and groceries

loans.name: Hernan Felipe

texts.es:
Hernan ha podido acumular grandes experiencias gratas en su vida, una de ellas es el haber podido trabajar en diferentes tiendas de abarrotes en el municipio de La Dorada.
El siempre fue muy inquieto y con gran vocación de servicio, cualidades que lo motivaron para iniciar con su propia tienda de abarrotes y hacerla muy reconocida en el sector.
Hoy en día es un hombre amable y muy emprendedor, siempre buscando alternativas para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos y comprando productos de calidad.
El solicita apoyo económico para obtener un préstamo y realizar la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, pues planea aumentar su oferta de productos y desea tener un inventario mucho más grande, así podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes. 
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran distribuidora de víveres, considera que poco a poco y con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.
texts.en:
Hernan has been able to accumulate great, pleasant experiences in his life, one of which was to be able to work in different grocery stores in the municipality of La Dorada.
He was always very restless and with a great vocation to serve, qualities that motivated him to start his own grocery store and make it well known in his sector.
Nowadays he is a friendly and enterprising man, always looking for alternatives so that his customers feel well attended to and buying quality products.
He is requesting economic support in order to obtain a loan and to buy a selection of products for the family budget.  He plans to augment his product offerings and wishes to have a much greater inventory so as to have the products on hand for his clients.
His greatest dream is to be able to be a great distributor of foodstuffs.  He thinks that with the help of the corporation Interactuar little by little he will be able to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy a selection of products of the family budget.

loans.name: Jad 50292 Group

texts.en:
Meet Jamileh (the second lady from the right). She is a member of the Jad 50292 group in Lebanon, along with her three friends, Hamidi (the first on the far right side), Dana (the second from the left), and Mona (the first on the far left side). The four women have together chosen to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. These women have been longtime friends and have developed strong friendships with one another. Each works hard to support her family and improve her living conditions.

Jamileh is 53 years old, married, and has no children. She has been working from her house baking traditional Saj bread and special pastries for nine years. She specializes in preparing items for special occasions. She is a hardworking woman and financial supporter for her beloved husband.

Jamileh's loan will be invested to develop her home-based business properly, through increasing her necessary raw materials. This will enable her to increase production and expand her working sector, which is extremely expensive and hard to do in Lebanon without additional external support. 

Hamidi is a married mother of two. She is employed, and her portion of the loan will be used to replace furniture in her house. Dana is also a married mother of two. She is also employed. Her loan portion will be used to pay her children's school fees. Mona is married and has no children. She runs two businesses: a convenience store and a shoe shop. She will use her loan to develop both of her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ground nuts, beans, maize, millet, and others for selling.

loans.name: Broder Alexander

texts.es:
Broder ha sido un padre muy dedicado, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por su hija y su esposa; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 6 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposa y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 
Sus clientes son muy variados, trabaja solo todos los días de manera ambulante en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productivo como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de cargadores, accesorios para celular, entre otros, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada escolar, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Broder manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a su hija, para verla convertirse en profesional y tenga un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Broder has been a dedicated father who looks after his family, which consists of his daughter and his wife. He has always enjoyed working independently; he began to sell merchandise six years ago. Broder is responsible for supporting his family financially with the help of his wife. He needs to generate the resources with which to do this. 

Broder's customers are diverse. He works every day during the daytime in his ambulatory business. This job has the advantage of letting him be available to his family while also being a productive vendor. 

Broder is requesting this loan in order to buy his stock of cell phone chargers, accessories, and other items in bulk. This is a great opportunity in this season of the year because it will let him restock with more variety in order to meet the demand that grows when children go back to school. During this time, he can make more profits for his family. 

Broder reports that his biggest wish is to continue supporting his family financially and to provide his daughter with an education. He would like to see her become a professional and have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy his stock of cell phone chargers, accessories, and other items in bulk.

loans.name: Thomas's Group

texts.en:
This season is not the first one that Thomas is working alongside One Acre Fund. He has been a member for a few years now, having joined the program in 2011 and, although he is the only person featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Thomas is often described by his community as a very resourceful person and decided to be the one to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. Like many of his fellow farmers, Thomas decided he wanted to be part of the One Acre Fund community in order to earn enough to send his children to school and hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

This loan will not only help Thomas but the whole group, who will receive maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Sherif

texts.en:
Sherif is 38 years old and the married father of three children. While his wife works for a private company as a cleaner, he works very hard all day long in order to support his family, even though his salary is very low. He is very fortunate to be able to work from home, in a workshop he has, helping to keep costs lower and give him more time to be around his family.
 
He makes tables and chairs for outdoor enjoyment and has been in business for more than 20 years. Sherif has developed a good reputation for his professionalism and his quality of work and is very popular. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new machine to cut wood. He knows that this investment will help him to be able to work more effectively and more efficiently, thereby increasing his income even more. His goal is to expand his business in the future and be able to hire an employee. He appreciates all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine to cut wood for his business

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en: Sophan’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sophan makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a tailor and she sells groceries to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Laxmishree Shg Group

texts.en:
The “Laxmishree Shg” group will begin its first cycle with Peoples Forum. The group has ten members and is directed by an executive board of which Manorama is president. The members' businesses are varied: selling food, selling vegetables, selling milk, selling groceries, etc. 

This loan will benefit their small businesses where Manorama is a member. Manorama joined Peoples Forum one year ago. She has a business selling food. She learned about this work years ago with her mother, and then after she married, she decided to have her own business. 

The loan will be an increase in capital (to buy groceries at wholesale) to acquire products from the wholesalers in Dhenkanal City and then make her food to sell in her stall. 

This work will enable her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is married with three children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Faik

texts.en: Faik, together with his wife, is working in agriculture. In the past, they sold clothing in a market, but had difficulty making much profit and recently decided to try being involved in agriculture instead. They have started by keeping a cow in order to sell the milk and other dairy products in the market. He has already seen that this field of business is more profitable and has been seeing success already. Now, he is requesting a loan to purchase a second cow to further increase his business and success. Although his brother lives in a Western European country and sometimes sends money to assist, he prefers to be able to provide for his family by himself and work hard. He is very optimistic about this business and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase a second cow to further increase his business and success

loans.name: Snejana

texts.en:
Snejana is 46 years old. She lives in Pyanj district. She is married and has children aged 16 and 24. Her husband emigrated to Russia and works there as foreman.

Snejana graduated from medical college and worked as a nurse for 15 years. But today she is engaged in the livestock business. Her son helps her with this activity. She has 5 years experience in this kind of business, and always gets a good income. Aside from the livestock business, she is involved in agriculture.

Currently Snejana wants to significantly boost her animal count, and increase her income. She hopes that, with support of Kiva lenders, she will be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of young calves.

loans.name: Silver

texts.en: Silver used the previous loan to buy barbed wire to fence and improve on his pasture for animals. Silver is fifty three years old, and married with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Silver is a farmer rearing animals and growing crops such as bananas, maize, cotton, G nuts (ground nuts), etc.  He has a dream of selling the best quality products in the area. However, his challenge is  pests, diseases and natural calamities. Silver needs a loan to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de pan dulce, de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ya tiene muchos clientes establecidos, con sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pan dulce por mayor para tener mejore ganancia y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 41, lives in her own house with her family.  She has been making a living for several years from the sale of sweet breads itinerantly in different suburbs.  She already has many established customers.  With her sales, she is able to move forward.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sweet breads wholesale in order to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweet breads wholesale.

loans.name: Jorge De Jesus

texts.es:
Jorge, de 55 años, inicio con su oficio de pintura y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de Támesis, negocio que inicio con el afán de sostenerse y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una pistola para pintar.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a su familia brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor y una optima estabilidad económica.

Apoya a Jorge con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Jorge, de 55 años, inicio con su oficio de pintura y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de Támesis, negocio que inicio con el afán de sostenerse y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una pistola para pintar.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a su familia brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor y una optima estabilidad económica.

Apoya a Jorge con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!

loans.use: compra de una pistola para pintar.

loans.name: Erick's Group

texts.en:
Erick is 29 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. He has one child and is married. As a group leader, Erick is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Erick's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing two solar lights as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Erick and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana engages in soft drinks vending. She sells soft drinks and in addition, she also prepares and sells snack food like puto (rice cake). She is a 49-year-old single woman from Dulag, Leyte. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional supplies of soft drinks and ingredients like flour, sugar and margarine. These ingredients will be used in producing rice cake, and she will sell it in her local community. This will enable her to earn more and handle her finances. She could now prepare healthy diets that are very essential in her day to day living.

Susana dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable to become sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy  additional supplies of soft drinks and ingredients like flour, sugar and margarine

loans.name: Zenfira

texts.en:
Zenfira is a 50-year-old woman and lives with two children in Agdash. She is very kind and is a hardworking woman. Zenfira has been raising chicken, turkey, and duck for 23 years. She likes her work and she takes care of her poultry. In this business, her monthly income is 200 AZN. Every weekend, she sells her poultry in the local bazaar. She raises healthy poultry so people prefer to buy chicken from her.

Zenfira wants to improve her business to build a new pen for her chicken. In this way, she will be able to raise more poultry. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan from Kiva. Zenfira hopes lenders will help her.

loans.use: to build a new pen for her chickens.

loans.name: Elizabeth De Jesus

texts.es: Elizabeth de 39 años de edad vive en  casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, aged 39, lives in her own home with her husband and their two children.

She has been making a living selling personal care products for many years now. She set up her business at her home and also sells her products as a street vendor, travelling through different neighbourhoods. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, and the like, wholesale. This way, she will be able to continue with her business and generate a better income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, and the like, wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y embutidos desde hace un año, su negoció esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes fijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y asi continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 31 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has worked in the sale of dairy products and cold cuts for one year. Her business is located in her house, and she has many loyal clients. She is asking for a credit to purchase more products at wholesale and be able to continue with her sales to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products and cold cuts at wholesale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities including biscuits, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, soap, candles, candies and seasonings. She is a 57-year-old married woman with five children from Mayorga, Leyte. One of her children is still attending school. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. During planting season, she also toils the land and grows rice.

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks for the store, purchase pig feeds and fertilizers. These stocks will help generate more income from the store. She will raise and sell healthy pigs, and this will also improve the yield of her farm. Because of this, her income will augment and start to handle her finances.

She is determined to expand her sources of livelihood, to be productive, and for her to continue financing the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store, purchase pig feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel raises and sells hogs. He has been raising hogs for 12 years now. He is a 38-year-old married man with four children from Mcarthur, Leyte. His oldest child is 14 and the youngest is 8.

He has requested a loan to buy pig feed, medicines and additional swine. These tools are very important to improve his hog raising business. He can now raise healthy pigs and produce more piglets to sell. They will provide his family with nutritious food and better living conditions.

In the future, Manuel is determined to improve his hog raising business to make it successful for him to finance the schooling of all his children and provide them with a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, medicines and additional swine.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia comes from Kanywambogo trading center in the Kamwenge district. She is a widow with 7 children, and all of her children are in school. Scovia is a very honest and hard working woman.

Scovia deals in small scale agriculture. She grows coffee and rears a few goats so she can earn income to improve the living standard of her family. It is from this that she gets money to provide for their basic needs and pay school fees for her children. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to help her buy pesticides and mulches for her coffee plantation. She thinks this will help to increase her crop yields and earn more income. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and mulch for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stationary for her library to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of one son and two daughters. Two years ago, Ahmad opened an auto repair workshop in the city, where he mainly repairs motorcycles. It is a good business since the citizens use motorcycles a lot in their work. Ahmad would like to improve his workshop and expand it. 

Ahmad took a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more repair parts and new tools for his workshop. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his productivity and also increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more repair parts and new tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like biscuits, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, soy sauce, noodles, canned goods and soap. She is a 47-year-old married woman with no dependents. She has been engaged in running a store for 5 years now.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy various stock for the store, and to buy piglets for her new hog raising business. With these tools, she will be able to sell a variety of goods and probably generate higher income. She will also raise pigs in the coming months. With this, slowly her sources of income will become stable. She will pay her obligations and better be able to handle her finances.

In the future, she would like her current business to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy various stock for the store, and to buy piglets for her new hog raising business.

loans.name: Umidakhon

texts.en:
Umedaxon is 23 years old. She is married and has 2 children in kindergarten, two and four years old.  

Umedakhon is engaged in sewing. She started sewing three years ago with help of her grandmother. In her work, she likes to sew different dresses and see the pleasure in her clients eyes. Umedaxon is a clever and nimble girl. 

In the future, she will try to expand her business.  She has long wanted to repair her house, but unfortunately her income does not allow her to be able to. Today, she decided to get a loan and to pursue her dream. She needs your support and expresses gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 56-year-old Palestinian refugee, the father of five children, who lives and works in a Palestinian refugees camp. This is Adnan, a specialized electrician who works hard to develop his talents and business to provide his family with the necessary standards of living. Adnan has been fixing and maintaining all types of household appliances and many other electronics since 1985. He is working hard to apply his previously acquired college knowledge to cope with the newly released technology in a smart way. He wants to make sure that his business will continue moving in parallel with the daily released technologies.

Working in a refugee camp is an obstacle on its own, so he has to work harder to expand his business since he is limited to the camp's citizens. Although he has a low income because of the limited access to the camp, he still had the chance to provide one of his children with a university degree in Math, and he is working hard to provide the others with the best education possible too. 

His previously acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua was very successful in improving his business, so he is very anxious to acquire the current loan.  He will invest the loan by buying special newly released items which he will display to develop his retail business.

loans.use: to buy newly released items which he will display in his business.

loans.name: Buuhalai

texts.en:
Buuhalai is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Applied Mathematics and Informatics. Here is her story:

“It seems to me that my family’s life consists in working only. We are seven in our family: my parents, elder three sisters, me and my younger brother. My eldest sister is married and has her own family. My other two sisters are the students at other local universities, and my brother is a school-boy. My parents are farmers and shepherds. We live in the village and have a yard, where we grow vegetables to feed ourselves. Besides, my parents are seasonal shepherds. They take other people’s cattle and move to the mountains for summer, and come back in the beginning of fall, and for their service they earn additional money. In winters we make carpets at home, this work requires much effort and unhealthy, but we need to get money in order to struggle with this life. Thanks to all our attitude, we have money to live and pay for our daily necessities. We work, we earn some money, we spend it and then we work again, so such my family’s situation bothers me and I want to change my life and the world around me.

I chose this department, because I am good in Math from my school years. There are few girls in our Program as boys are more disposed to Math than girls, so I am happy to be one of these selected girls-students. I have big goals for the future; one of them is to continue my studies in Europe after receiving a Bachelor degree in AUCA, then opening a school for deep learning of Math in my village. I can contribute to my country’s development by this way. And I need AUCA’s education to achieve these goals.

As we know, Kiva changes lives for better, lives of those, who are so similar to me. Receiving Kiva loan means to me having a hope for the bright future and meeting new unknown, but kind and warm-hearted people.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 31-year-old married woman from Yata, a village near Hebron city. She lives with her husband and five kids, three sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a trader in the city.  Eman works as a farmer where she plants seasonal crops. She uses greenhouses to ensure she has a very good quality harvest.

Eman took a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more seeds and seedlings for her farm. By taking this loan, Eman will be able to increase the farm productivity and also earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells bread, noodles, seasonings, canned goods and soft drinks.  She is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children, her oldest child is 24 and the youngest is 5. Her husband earns a living by fishing. 

Wilfreda is asking for a loan to buy supplies like beer, liquor and other stock for the store. These items will fill her store again and attract more buyers. She will create more more sales, thus increasing her daily earnings. She will then be able to provide a healthy diet for her whole family.

In the future, she would like to expand her business to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like beer, liquor and other beverages.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 19-year-old young woman, from Batumi city, west Georgia. Of her mother and two sisters, Maia is the only one employed. She works as an administrator at the beauty salon and gets a fixed salary of about 300 GEL. 

This income is really insignificant for a family of four, even to cover their basic needs. To progress in life and to generate more income, Maia has thought of becoming a hair stylist and has great desire to start working in the profession. 

She has requested a loan from a local financial institution. Her loan request was approved as a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. With this loan, Maia will purchase all the needed tools, including hair dryers, scissors and other accessories, and will start serving clients from the salon where she currently works. 

As a result of her new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of her family will increase significantly. Maia will be able to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and start working as a stylist.

loans.name: Zadock's Group

texts.en:
Zadock is a 50-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Zadock has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Zadock described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also purchase a solar light in addition to fertilizer and maize.  With a solar light, he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With this loan, Zadock’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights. With the profits from this season’s harvest, Zadock plans to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a hardworking woman, born in 1976. She is married with three children and lives in a rural area.

Her husband is a builder of national houses. He has a lot of clients and earns a good profit. She works seasonally converting apricots. She has six years of practice in this business. She has general medical education and is a responsible and punctual person. 

She is planning to renovate her house but is in need of financial support to buy building materials for the renovation.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovating her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new stove, plates and dishes

loans.name: Lazarus's Group

texts.en:
Lazarus is 46 years old and has 9 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 9 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Lazarus has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Lazarus also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Lazarus's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybridized seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used items to resell in his general store.

loans.name: Lear's Group

texts.en:
Lear, pictured above, has 5 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Lear is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Lear has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Lear is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 5 acres will be planted by Lear's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 9 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.fr: Sekete est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Amka», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un Chômeur, âgée de 55 ans, mère 10 enfants dont 4 étudient et 6 sont mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu d’une institution de la place. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés dans un marché de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 100 poissons. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Sekete is a retailer and member of the loan group 'Amka' which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 55 years old, married to an unemployed man, and mother to ten children, four of whom attend school and six of whom are married.  

Sekete has been selling salted fish at the town market for fifteen years.  She began her business with funds she received from a local institution.  She plans to use her loan to buy one hundred fish for resale.

Sekete would like to increase her profits and feed and educate her children.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 100 fish for resale.

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Mr Kossivi âgé de 39ans a 03 enfants en charge.Ils sont âgés de 13,9 et 06ans et sont tous scolarisés. Mécanicien de profession, Kossivi après sa formation a ouvert en 2002 son atelier et se fait aider par 02 personnes. Il sollicite un deuxième crédit pour acheter des matériaux afin de renforcer son atelier. A l'avenir, elle désire agrandir l'activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Kossivi is 39 years old and has three children in his care.  They are thirteen, nine and six years old, and all attend school.  He is a car mechanic by profession and opened his own workshop following his training.  He has two people who work with him in his workshop.

This will be the second loan for Kossivi and he will use it to buy equipment to improve his workshop.

In the future, Kossivi would like to expand his business and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his vehicle repair workshop.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's Group is comprised of 10 farmers in the district of Kakamega North and is being represented by Irene, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 54 years old, is married, and has 3 children. Irene has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Irene isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in that she has learned a lot from farming trainings. This year, Irene will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Irene's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Essiawonam

texts.fr: Esiawonam vit avec son enfant de 07ans à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de mèches, des boissons et produits cosmétiques à Lomé depuis 2009. Elle manque de fonds pour acheter plus de marchandises donc madame Esiawonam demande un prêt à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif. Elle souhaite élargir son activité et assurer l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Esiawonam lives with her seven-year-old child in Lomé.  She has been selling hair extensions, beauty products and drinks in Lomé since 2009.  As she is short of funds to buy stock, she has requested this loan from the field partner, WAGES.  This will help her to achieve her target of expanding her business and educating her child.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetic products and alcoholic drinks for retail.

loans.name: Nooran

texts.en:
Nooran is a 50-year-old married woman. She is running a milk-selling business with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Nooran’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Nooran  has requested a loan of 50,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR)  to buy one more buffalo so she can cater to more customers and thus provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo so she can cater to more customers and thus provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.name: Atossowè

texts.fr: Agée de 47ans, Mme Atossowoè a deux enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins des siens elle s’est lancée dans la vente de charbons de bois depuis un moment : elle s’approvisionne à Anié une ville tropicale située dans la région des plateaux au  nord de la ville de Lomé et revend après à domicile. Ce troisième crédit lui servira à augmenter son actif pour satisfaire la demande, assurer un avenir radieux à elle et à ses enfants.
texts.en: Atossowoè is 47 years old and has two children. In order to support her family, she began selling charcoal some time ago. She buys her supply at Anié, a tropical town situated in the highlands north of the city of Lomé, and she sells the charcoal out of her home. This will be her third loan and it will serve to add to her stock in trade so as to satisfy demand and ensure a bright future for her and her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ayawo
