Andrei is 33. He is married with a 6-month-old daughter. Andrei grows cucumbers and tomatoes on his own land plot in Vodyanoye. He has been in this business for nine years. At the moment he owns two land plots and seven greenhouses with heating systems.

Andrei is planning to construct new greenhouses and he needs an additional 60,000 Grivnyas to invest in this project. As his business continues to grow Andrei is hoping to finish construction of his private house, so that his family can move in and live more comfortably, especially since they have a baby girl now.

loans.use: to construct new greenhouses

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is a seamstress and works from Monday to Saturday making t-shirts and jackets. Jaime has two kids: one is a thirteen-year-old girl and the other one is a fourteen-year-old boy At the moment, Jaime is living with his family in a rented room but only with his son because his wife and daughter are in Brasil. Jaime needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine. He works hard and hopes you can help him because he wants to bring his wife and daughter to Bolivia.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Suzin

texts.en: Suzin used the previous loan to buy pigs for slaughtering. Suzin is a thirty-two-year-old male married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Suzin is a butcher selling pork meat and he is also a farmer growing crops such us cotton, rice and coffee in order to earn a living. He has a dream of becoming the leading pork supplier in the area though he complains of limited capital and market competition, which in the end affects his expected returns. Suzin will use the loan to buy pigs for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughtering

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
This is Augustine. He was born in Kitaingo village, which is situated in Eastern province of Kenya. He has seven siblings and grew up in a modest home, where his father worked as a teacher to put food on the table. Augustin's mom worked at home and supported the family. Through primary and secondary education, Augustine had to sacrifice going to boarding school in order to help his parents with menial work. For example, he worked in farming right after his secondary school national examination in order to raise funds for his college education.
 
In his freshman year of college at Tsavo Park Hotel Institute, Augustine found independence and a stronger sense of direction. He immediately enrolled for a certificate course in Commercial Management. The experience of being a student in this institution greatly defined him and lifted his interest in pursuing a diploma in Hotel and Catering Management.

In 2002, after the diploma, Augustine spent four years working in the hotel industry.During this time, the greatest challenges were the foreseeable lay-offs during off-peak seasons and fears of job insecurity brought about by the fact that hotel industry is very sensitive to changes in external environment, such as disease epidemics, terrorism, and travel advisories. For these reasons, Augustine decided to move his career away from hotels and closer to other businesses in the service industries.
  
In 2006, he joined Cellucom Kenya Limited, a mobile phone services company. He worked under the Distribution Department as an office assistant. He later joined Zain Africa where he worked for five years as the head of the mailing room. His duties including handling all incoming and outgoing mail and invoices. From Zain Africa, Augustine's fate led him to a social enterprise whose mission is to elevate the quality of life of smallholder rural farmers, Juhudi Kilimo (Swahili for "Effort in farming").

Augustine says that his job in Juhudi Kilimo is the most fulfilling of all the jobs he has held in his career. He gets a feeling of self-satisfaction from being an integral part of a growing organization that seeks to maximize social impact as well as to stay financially viable. From his many years of experience, he knows he has enough to bring to Juhudi’s table to shape the organization’s future and make it the leading microfinance organisation in East Africa. Also, from his years of experience, he has identified huge gaps in his knowledge and skills that need to be filled. Augustine believes in the Kiva process and mission so much that he applied for a loan to pay for a diploma course in business management.

With your faith and support, Augustine will be in a position to sharpen his business knowledge and skills in order to make the best out of his current post as an administrative assistant. He is a hard worker who is rich on ideas but poor on capital.  With your loan investment in his education, he will seize this timely opportunity of going back to school and reminding himself of one or two things about service delivery because, Augustine says, services do expire.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en:
Benson's Group is formed by ten farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Benson, who is the group leader pictured above. He is fifty-one years old, married and has four children. Benson has been a farmer for twelve years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Benson isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to save more money ever since. This year, Benson will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Benson's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth, pictured above, has been a farmer for twenty years and is now proud to represent her group of thirteen farmers in Kakamega North District. She is forty-two years old, married and has five children.

Ruth likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to save more money. Ruth plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Ruth’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eleven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is twenty-eight years old, married with five children, living in Kasese in Uganda. Francis is a farmer growing crops and vegetables such as maize, cabbages, cotton, rice, beans and others for selling to generate income for looking after his family. Francis has a dream of becoming a model farmer in his area. However, he is faced with  a challenge of pests and diseases and like other farmers the unpredictable weather changes. Francis intends to use the loan to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.name: Agnetta's Group

texts.en:
Agnetta is fifty-eight years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed of fifteen farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Agnetta has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Agnetta also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Agnetta's Group will be able to receive a total of fourteen solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Pjeter

texts.en:
Pjeter is thirty-three years old and has been living with his mother who is blind and his two sisters. They live in a village, in a very little house that barely fits all of them. They have a yard of about 1,000 meters wide where they plant vegetables for their family’s needs and have some grapevines and a plum orchard.

One of his sisters is their mother’s caretaker and receives a government income of about $125 per month, which is equal to his mother's disability income. His other sister works in a shoe factory for a pay of $200 per month. Pjeter has been working in construction.

Pjeter is requesting this loan to make some renovations to their so-called ‘house’ because it has been very cold inside due to the fact that there are still some elements missing from it. 

Pjeter has been photographed next to his concrete mixer machine that he will use in his construction activities.

loans.use: to make some renovations to his family home

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorleny tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijas, una esta en primaria y la otra es madre adolescente de una niña de un año. Hace 11 años Yorleny tenía un bazar en su casa, pero debido a las bajas que presentó ella decide dedicarse únicamente a lo que tiene más experiencia, lo cual es la costura, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, sed para baños, uniformes y diversidad de productos. Actualmente le esta enseñando a su hija a confeccionar ropa para que logre sufragar una parte de los grandes gastos de su bebé. Solicita este crédito para comprar telas, hilos y unas tijeras nuevas para confeccionar los pedidos que le solicita su clientela. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y facilidad en los trámites. En un futuro Yorleny sueña con comprar mejor equipo, preferiblemente industrial para perfeccionar sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Yorleny is 36 years old and married with two daughters. One is in grade school and one is the adolescent mother of a one-year-old girl.

For 11 years Yorleny had a bazaar in her house but due to drawbacks, she decided to focus exclusively on what she is most experienced in: sewing, clothing manufacture, towels for bathrooms, uniforms and a variety of other products. She is teaching her daughter to make clothes to cover part of the baby's many expenses. 

Yorleny is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread and new scissors to meet her clients' orders. She chose Kiva partner Fundación Mujer ("Women's Foundation") for their low rate of interest and ease in processing. In the future, Yorleny dreams of purchasing better equipment, preferably industrial, to hone her products.

loans.use: buy raw materials.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer que tiene 40 años de vida y habita en vivienda humilde desde hace 6 años, al lado de sus 5 hijos 3 mayores de edad y una niña de 15 años y un varón de 12 años de edad. Hace 10 años Blanca logró adquirir un pequeño local en el mercado municipal en el cual vende frutas y verduras, para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos de los cuales 2 de los mayores le apoyan económicamente gracias a sus trabajos. Al observar que sus hijos ya son hombres Blanca también ha observado que  su vivienda es muy pequeña y que viven en hacinamiento, por lo que desea construir un cuarto dormitorio, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda y poder brindar una mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 40 year old woman. She has lived in a humble house for 6 years beside her 5 children, 3 of them adults, a 15 year old daughter and a 12 year old son. Ten years ago Blanca obtained a small stall in the municipal market where she sells fruit and vegetables. She does this to raise her children of who two of the older ones support her economically thanks to their jobs.

Observing that her children are now grown-ups, Blanca has also observed that her house is very small and they live in overcrowded conditions. So she wants to construct a bedroom. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar to build a bedroom at her house to provide more comfort for her children.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and re-bar to construct a bedroom on her house.

loans.name: Nallely

texts.en:
Nallely is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

Nallely is 20 years old, single, and lives in her parents’ house. She has owned a convenience store, which was inherited from her family, for four years now; during her free time she enjoys listening to music.

Her store is approximately 100 feet square and is located in her parents’ house. There she has: three refrigerators, a digital scale, a slicer and five stands.

 Nallely is asking for this loan in order to stock up her business and take advantage of promotions the suppliers have when buying by wholesale. 

With the effort she puts into her store Nallely aspires to be able to make it a bigger and more productive business.

loans.use: to stock up her business buying by wholesale

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a forty-eight-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of ten farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mary has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Mary described her harvest as very good last year but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kpanmanga - Tamalgu Group

texts.en:
Ayi is a forty-year-old hard working woman from Tamalgu in the Northern region of Ghana. Ayi is married and has five children with two of the children attending school. Ayi is the individual pictured with the hands on the shea nuts among the members who are squatting.

Ayi is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last five years. The name of the group is ‘Kpanmanga - Tamalgu’. Ayi earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets in Ghana and for export.

Ayi and ‘Kpanmanga - Tamalgu have asked for a loan of GHS 8,800. Ayi’s share of the loan is GHS 300, which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing. Ayi aspires to earn more income, expand her business as well as to repay this loan and support her family to pay her children’s school expenses.

Ayi sincerely thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Suglo Nbori Buni - Tamalgu Group

texts.en:
Fati is a forty-year-old hard working woman from Tamalgu in the Northern region of Ghana. Fati is married and has eight children, four of whom attend school. Fati is the individual pictured with the hands on the shea nuts among the members who are squatting.

Fati is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last five years. The name of the group is ‘Suglo Nbori Buni - Tamalgu’. Fati earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets in Ghana and for exporting.

Fati and ‘Suglo Nbori Buni - Tamalgu’ have asked for a loan of GHS 8,800. Fati’s share of the loan is GHS 400, which would be used to buy shea nuts for butter processing. Fati aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family to pay her children’s school expenses.

Fati thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for butter processing.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is a 23-year-old single student majoring in management in his fourth year at university in the city. He is from the Takeo province in Cambodia. Seng has also worked for an organization since 2014, earning around USD 6 each day. 

Due to a shortage of finances to pay his fourth-year tuition fees, he would like to request a loan. This loan will help him in earning a Bachelor’s degree. Seng wants to work in a bank or in micro finance, so he will be able to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay his fourth-year tuition fees

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Mr. Batmunkh, 35 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been running computer and phone repair shop since 2007. His wife is an ingredient maker at a sausage factory. Their children go to secondary school.

Batmunkh is requesting a loan of 1300 USD to buy cell phone spare parts in large quantity for his business. As different types of phones are sold on the market, it became necessary to store various spare parts for each particular phone. His shop is quite well known in Ulaanbaatar and he doesn't want to lose customer trust.

loans.use: to buy cell phone spare parts in large quantity

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, hija y un nieto. Ella es una mujer increíble quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta de pan dulce en el mercado central de su localidad. Tiene mucho tiempo de contar con este negocio y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Catalina solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, hierro, etc. para reparar el techo de la vivienda lo antes posible dado que se encuentra en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Catalina is 59 years old and she lives in her own house with her husband, her daughter and a grandson.

She is an amazing woman who makes a living selling sweet bread in her town's central market. She has had this occupation for a long time and it is how she provides for her family.

Catalina is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized steel sheets, wood, iron, etc. to repair the roof of her house as soon as possible, since it is in poor conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel sheets, wood, iron, etc. to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Samen

texts.en:
Samen, who is 48 years old, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has four children in total; two are married and live independently while the other two are single and live under her support. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business in a small rice farmland which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for thirty years. 

Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en: Bardhe is applying for this loan to do all the soil preparation for planting potatoes and also buy seeds. In addition, her husband has been using an old vehicle to transport the fresh products to the farmer's market. Its license expired and he needs to apply for a new one. Thus, a little portion of this loan will be used for this purpose.

loans.use: to prepare the soil for planting, buy potato seeds and pay for a vehicle licence

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Liberatha is 46 years old. She is married with three children, aged between 5 and 15 years, all of them go to school. The group is called ABADAHEMUKA which means “respectful” in English. The members of the group sell different products, and they have common goals to scale their business for a better future. 

She sells food stuffs, and has been in a business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to resell.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus comes from Kitwe in Ibanda town. He is married with six children who are all in school. 

He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income. Deus is also a professional teacher where he earns an additional income. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him buy more cattle for fattening. He will use the rest of the money to pay his children's school fees. His major challenge is drought, which makes water and grass dry. This means that his his animals are left without anything to eat.

His future plan is to construct a dam to store water during the dry season. Deus is a very honest and hard working man.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Mariama B's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré le 23 décembre 2014 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Mariama, âgée de 39 ans (debout à l’extrême droite et levant la main droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons, elle s’active dans la transformation de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète les graines non décortiquées par sac  de 50 kg dans son village et les environs, pour la revente au marché international de la sous région après transformation.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sacs de 50 kg d'arachide non décortiqué à 10 000 Fr CFA l’un pour la transformation en pâte d'arachide et la vente.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne, améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois, which was newly created on December 23, 2014, is made up women from a village group who joined the program in order to make their activities in small-trade more profitable. They are also busy with rain-fed agriculture. A good atmosphere livens up the group’s meetings. 

Mariama, who is 39 years old (standing at the very right and raising her right arm), is the group's main borrower. She is married and a mother of 6 children, 2 of which are boys. Her work consists of making peanut paste. She buys undehulled seeds in bags of 50kg in her village and the surrounding area. After making the paste, she resells it to an international market of the sub-region. 

With her new loan, she expects to buy four 50kg bags of undehulled peanuts, for 10 000 Fr CFA, to make peanut paste and to sell. 

With the earnings, she will build up her savings, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four 50kg bags of undehulled peanuts for 10 000 Fr CFA, to make peanut paste and to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
A loan of $800 is offered to Jacinta to improve her business. Jacinta lives in Ermera; she is married and she has six children. Most of her daily income is from her business so she is still happy to do her business. 

Jacinta started her business in 2011, with her own working capital of $800. She requested this loan to add to her principal amount to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as aqua, sauce, soy sauce, cooking oil, sweets, eggs, notebooks, rice, shampoo, seasoning and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks, according to what people like, because it has become her activity. 

Jacinta is happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And she will have management for her business.

loans.use: To buy aqua, sauce, soy sauce, cooking oil, sweets, eggs, notebooks, rice, shampoo, seasonings and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is a 47-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  

But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Naziran’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of two children. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. This will allow her to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 53-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has three children. She is a dedicated mother, and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation; now she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 43 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Sakina ’s son, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Sakina  has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her son. He wants to replace auto body and new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Sakina  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace the auto body and new tires

loans.name: Mussurat

texts.en:
Mussurat is 47 years old, a married woman. Her son (also shown in the photo) is an electrician by profession. He provides his services in his locality and earns a good amount of income to contribute in the detail. 

In order to cater to more customers, he needs to purchase different wires, switches, charges, and cable. For this reason, Mussurat has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR. It will help her son in catering to more customers to increase his net income.

loans.use: to purchase different wires, switches, charges, and cable.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married and she has three children. Now she has one idea in requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin: to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she is earning a good income from this business and she lives near the main road. Every day many people come to buy her gasoline so she is still happy to do her business, so she took this loan to buy more gasoline. 

Juliana has been involved in business activities since 2013; she started with her own working capital of $300. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, she said with this loan she will improve her management for her business and to run a bigger business  in the future. She also raises animals like pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses.

Tahira is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time and generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 17 Mai 2007 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 34 ans et mère de 06 enfants dont 03 garçons et 03 filles âgés de 05 à 20 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de boulette de poisson accompagnée de sauce  et de fruits selon la saison au marché central de la commune. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de son commerce pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter 01 à 02 paniers de poisson et des fruits pour une valeur de 50 000 Fr CFA et divers ingrédients pour la préparation des boulettes.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer activement à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Created on May 17, 2007 at the initiation of the banc villageois, this group is made up of women who have experience in the bancs villageois program. They all come from the same village and share strong links between solidarity and help. Their main activity is small-trade. 

Aissatou (sitting at the very right with her arm raised) is the group's main borrower. She is married, 34 years old, and a mother of 6 children, 3 boys and 3 girls, between the ages of 5 and 20. Her work consists of selling fish balls with sauce and fruit, depending on the season of central market in the commune. She has a good command of her business from years of practice. 

With her new loan, she would like to buy 1 to 2 baskets of fish and fruit for a price of 50 000 Fr CFA and various ingredients for preparing fish balls. 

With her earnings, she expects to actively participate in the management of daily expenses and to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy 1 to 2 baskets of fish and fruit for a price of 50 000 Fr CFA and various ingredients for preparing fish balls.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn Bình Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. She is 36 years old and she is married, with three children.

Thúy is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 Thôn Bình Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

In 2008, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thúy has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her children, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: 0103270003 Thôn Bắc Sơn Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Liên has a service to do the wedding preparation. She is applying for a loan to purchase a cloth, a table, chairs, speakers, and a microphone to do the wedding preparing service. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Liên is 39 years old and she is married with 3 children. Liên is the group leader of the 0103270003 Thôn Bắc Sơn Hoằng Phụ solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cloth, a table, chairs, speakers, a microphone to do the wedding preparing service.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mai operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. Mai has been involved in this business for 8 years.

Mai is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. Mai is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 - Thôn tiến 27 -Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mai has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Oul

texts.en:
Oul, 54, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has nine children in total -- eight are single and one is married. To make a living and support her family, she has been involved in a farming business since 1980. She grows rice and sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customers in the market. She is able to generate a net profit of USD 3 a day, on average.

In this farming season, Oui is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  

Oui is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long, 35, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three single children who she supports. To make a living and support her family, she has been involved in a farming business since 1995. 

She grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. She is able to generate a net profit of USD 2.00 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her bean plantation. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Nhóm 7 Thôn 7 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoan is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. Hoan works in agriculture raising livestock. Hoan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hoan faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Hoan is the group leader of the Nhóm 7 thôn 7 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is Hoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hoan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married and she has 6 children. She is applying for a loan of $ 800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she will use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including sugar, cigarettes, milks, aqua, sardines, candies, cooking oils and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. She has a shop of business. Maria has been involved in business activities since in 2006. She started with her own working capital of $ 500. She is earning a good income from selling because many people like to buy in her store, so she is still happy to do her business. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cigarettes, milks, aqua, sardines, candies, cooking oils and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Nhóm 04 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Xô works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Xô has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Xô is 58 years old and she is married with 3 children. Xô is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Xô joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xô has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Xô faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xô hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhung is 27 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Nhung works in agriculture raising livestock. Nhung has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future. 

Nhung is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 - Thôn Tiến 27 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2011, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nhung has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 - Thôn Tiến - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Oanh is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. Oanh lives  in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Oanh operates a food stall selling fish. Oanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Oanh is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 - Thôn Tiến - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. In 2010, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Oanh has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Haydee Cecilia

texts.es: Haydee de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo ella posee desde hace 11 años un comedor ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: carnes, pollos, arroz, maíz, verduras, frutas, refrescos, vegetales, etc. todo por mayor para variar su menú y así atender mejor a su clientes y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Haydee, 57, lives in her own home with her husband. For 11 years she has owned a cafeteria located in her place of residence. She has a lot of customers due to the good prices. With her earnings she has managed to get ahead. She is asking for a new loan in order to buy primary materials such as meats, chickens, rice, corn, fruits, drinks, vegetables etc. all in bulk so she can vary her menu and so take better care of her customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy meats, chickens, rice, corn etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es: Lucia es una mujer trabajadora que vive con su madre y su hermana y tiene 39 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es  su familia, es por ello que a base de mucho esfuerzo logro hace 5 años invertir en un microbús, el cual ha puesto a las órdenes de una escuela como transporte escolar, y es gracias a ello que logra salir adelante y apoyar a su madre con los gastos de su hogar. Lucia desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que en época de invierno el agua se filtra al interior de su vivienda, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, hierro y tejas para mejorar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible ya que desea evitar hacerlo en invierno por lo que aprovechara la época seca.
texts.en:
Lucia, 39, is a hardworking woman who lives with her mother and her sister. For her, family is most important. For this reason, she managed after five years of hard work to buy a minivan, which is used to transport orders for a school. This allows her to get ahead and help her mother with household expenses.

Lucia wants to improve the roof of her home, which is deteriorating. In the winter, water seeps through to the interior. Lucia is requesting a loan through Kiva partner FUSAI to invest in galvanized steel, wood, iron and tiles to repair the roof as soon as possible. She wants to avoid doing it in the winter and instead wants to take advantage of the dry season.

loans.use: invest in galvanized steel, wood, iron and tiles to improve the roof of her house.

loans.name: Serjmyadag

texts.en:
Serjmyadag is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their children all go to secondary school. She and her husband have been doing interior decoration work since 2004. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and is too small for the children to grow. Serjmyadag is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to buy building materials, such as bricks and cement, for renovation and expansion. 

After that, her family will live in a comfortable, warm place where less coal is burned. Burning of coal is the main contributor to the severe air pollution in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to renovate and expand her house and burn less coal.

loans.name: Fatoumata Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 17 Mai 2007 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants : 03 garçons et une fille âgés de 05 à 20 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des produits de consommation courante à savoir : le riz, le thé vert, le sucre et divers condiments et bouillons culinaires qu’elle achète au marché hebdomadaires pour la revente au village. Elle  a une bonne maîtrise de cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  08 sacs de riz de 50 kg, 02 sacs de sucre, des paquets de thé vert et divers autres produits alimentaires.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la  scolarisation des enfants et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Created on May 17, 2007 at the initiation of the banc villageois, this group is made up of women who have experience in the bancs villageois program. They all come from the same village and share strong links between solidarity and help. Their main activity is small-trade. 

Fatoumata (sitting at the far right with her arm raised), is the group's main borrower. She is married and a mother of 4 children: 3 boys and 1 girl, between the ages of 5 and 20. Her business consists of buying and reselling common consumer products, namely: rice, green tea, sugar, various condiments and cooking stock, that she buys at the weekly market to resell in the village. She has a good command of the business from years of practice. 

With her new loan, she will buy eight 50kg bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, packets of green tea and various other food products. 

She will use her earnings to support her husband in sending her children to school and to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy eight 50kg bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, packets of green tea and various other food products.

loans.name: 3.08.22 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thắm has a business making iron furniture. Thắm has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thắm faces in her business is the lack of capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase more iron to make furniture to sell.

Thắm is 34 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 03.08.22 Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. In 2014, Thắm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thắm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Thắm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more iron to make furniture to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Thôn Lý Đông Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiên raises pigs to sell. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hiên faces in her business is lack of capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase more piglets to raise.

Hiên is 36 years old and is married with three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 12 thôn Lý Đông xã Thăng Bình Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. In 2010, Hiên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiên has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hiên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María, desde niña sus padres la pusieron a trabajar y fue a la escuela por esa razón, ahora está casada y junto a su esposo tienen un panadería en su hogar; tienen 2 hijos, quienes todavía viven con ellos, el horario de trabajo es de 4:00 a.m a 3:00 p.m.

María, hace ya 10 años junto a su esposo decidieron colocar una panadería en donde elaboran pan dulce, pan francés y otro tipo de pan.- La elaboración de pan la aprendieron juntos, debido a que tenían sus hijos pequeños y necesitaban muchas cosas, ahora sus hijos le ayudan a embolsar pan, para que sus trabajadores lo lleven a repartir a las tiendas.- Todo eso implica levantarse temprano a las 3:00 a.m. y durante el día preparar todo para el siguiente día.

El préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar harina, levadura y otros productos para la elaboración del pan, de esa manera logrará siempre mantener sus productos y darles una mejor atención a sus clientes y cubrir varias zonas más.

El sueño de María, junto a su esposo e hijos siempre ha sido mantener su panadería en pie y que día a día vaya creciendo, pues la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Since María was a girl, her parents pushed her to work and went to school for this reason. She is now married and along with her husband has a bakery in their own. They have two children who still live with them. She works from 4 am to 3pm.

10 years ago, María and her husband decided to start a bakery where they bake sweet bread, french bread and other kinds of bread. They learned how to make bread together, due to the fact that they had small children and they needed a lot of things. Now their children help them to bag the bread so that their workers can carry it on their deliveries to the shops. All of this means that they get up early at 3 am and during the day they prepare everything ready for the next day.

The loan María is asking for will be used to buy flour, yeast and other products for making bread. This means that they will always manage to make their products, give their clients better service and cover a wider area of zones.


María's dream, with her husband and children, has always been to keep her bakery working and growing little by little, since it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast and other products for making bread.

loans.name: Cholponai

texts.ru: Чолпонай 45 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. По характеру Чолпонай очень трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 10 овец, лошадь и 2 коровы, а также на земельном наделе мерою 3,25 ГА, она выращивает ячмень и клевер. Чолпонай получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 15,000 сом (KGS). Она хочет развить свой бизнес, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров, чтобы продавать экологически чистое, вкусное молоко. Доходы от кредита Чолпонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Cholponai is 45 and married with two children. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman who works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family. She has a diverse farm that includes 10 sheep, a horse and two cows as well as 3.25 hectares of land where she grows barley and clover. She receives a monthly income of about 15,000 KGS.

Cholponai wants to develop her business and therefore has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase two dairy cows in order to sell delicious organic milk. She plans to put profits from the loan into further improving her farm.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase  sales of organic dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old, and she is married with six children. Maria has been involved in business activities since 2010, when she started with her own working capital of USD 1,000. She is applying for a loan of USD 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for her business. 

Maria will buy additional supplies with this loan including cooking oil, sugar, aqua, biscuits, soaps, salts, detergent, cigarettes, herbs and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. She is earning a good income from her selling business, so she is taking this loan, to continue to improve her management. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her. She also has animals like buffalo, cows, pigs and dogs.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, aqua, biscuits, soaps, salts, detergent, cigarettes, herbs and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 55, lives in a community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children who live under her support. She runs a business selling chicken in a local market. She is able to earn USD $8 a day, on average. She has been in this business for twenty years. 

Currently her business is running poorly because she does not have enough chicken to satisfy her customers. To recover her trade, she has requested a Kiva to invest in her business. She is thankful for her lenders' generosity. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to invest in her business.

loans.name: Nicolas Antonio

texts.es: Nicolás de 51  años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 12 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nicolás, 51, lives in his own home with his family. He has owned a small shop for 12 years which is located in his place of residence. He sells a variety of products such as sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jell-o, sugar etc. and has a lot of customers due to the good prices.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy more merchandise in bulk, since it is his only source of income. This will mean that he can increase his income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sweet bread in bulk.

loans.name: Thương

texts.en:
Mrs. Thương has a business tailoring clothes in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoá province in Vietnam. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She is 27 years old and is married with 2 children.

In 2013, Thương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has already successfully repaid her 2 previous loans.

The main hardship that Thương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Thương hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is 32 years old and married with two children. She is a business woman in Ermera, Timor-Leste. She is applying for a loan of 800 USD from Tuba Rai Metin (Kiva's partner) to improve her business. She has a shop in the market selling used clothing. She is requesting this loan because she wants to buy more second-hand clothes such as short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, women's shirts, men's shirts, shorts and other clothes to sell. Marta started her business in 2010 with her working capital of 500 USD. She is earning a good income every day because she is selling in the center of the market where many people are interested in her second-hand clothes. She is very happy running her business. In addition to the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to acquire good management skills for her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is a 52-year old married woman living in Montebello, Leyte. She earns an income through retail trading in her locality. She has operated her sari-sari (retail store) for more than  20 years now, selling products ranging from food items to soap and toiletries. She now wants to expand her store in order to cater more customers.

Adeline is requesting a loan to buy more stock, including canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, rice, soft drinks and other beverages, bread, biscuits, and other items. A loan will help her improve her selection, thus attracting more buyers in her store. Adeline believes that this loan will help her boost her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase candies, aqua, cigarettes, glue, milks, sardines, and soft and hard drinks

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Sreytoch is a 23-year-old single factory worker who lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Her father is a civil servant, and her mother is a rice farmer. 

Sreytoch works from Monday to Friday, and she has been a factory worker since 2012, earning approximately USD 5 each day. She is also pursuing her university bachelor’s degree on Saturdays and Sundays, majoring in accounting. 

Sreytoch lacks the finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year, so she has decided to secure a loan. This loan will provider her with enough money to cover her university fees while she earns her bachelor’s degree. 

In the future, Sreytoch plans to find a better job in another company or organization.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 38 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing accommodations to students from the countryside at a low rent fee since 2011. The sanitation system in the 13-room building is broken and it needs urgent repair. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to repair the sanitation system. By doing so, he will restore the students' confidence and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the sanitation system of a building for rental.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: Jose de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el trabaja como fotógrafo desde hace 12 años, vende sus productos en los instituciones escolares y empresas y tiene clientes ya establecidos por su buen trabajo y los buenos precios, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de rollos, baterías, protectores y limpiador de cámaras, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Juan, who is 62 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He has worked as a photographer for 12 years. He sells his products in the educational institutions and businesses, and he now has established customers because of his good work and the good prices. He is applying again for a loan to purchase rolls of film, batteries, photo protectors, camera cleaner, etc., so that he can continue with his work, since it has gone very well for him in his sales, and so that he can have better income.

loans.use: to buy rolls of film, batteries, photo protectors, camera cleaner, etc.

loans.name: 03.08.10 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Duyên works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 58 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Duyên is the group leader of the 03.08.10 Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.  In 2010, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Duyên has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Duyên faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Duyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương works in agriculture, farming, poultry, and cattle.

Hương is 56 years old, and married with 2 children. Her business is in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Thôn Lý Tây Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Cương is 40 years old and she is married with two children. She works in agriculture, raising livestock, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is also the group leader of the Nhóm 08 thôn Lý Tây xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

The main hardship Cương faces in business is a lack of capital. In 2014, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She is currently applying for a loan to purchase more baby livestock she can raise and later sell. 

Cương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, she hopes her business will do well. She wants her children to do well in school, and wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sarik

texts.en:
Sarik, 58 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. He has five children. three of whom are single and live under his support.  The other two are married and live independently. 

To make a living and support his family, Sarik manages and operates a small farming business. He grows rice primarily and sells his products to local dealers and customers at the market. He has been in this business for 35 years. He earns about USD $2 a day. 

Sarik is requesting a Kiva loan through HKL to buy a motorbike. A personal vehicle will make it easier for him to travel. He is thankful to all his lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Thiện

texts.en:
Thiện works in agriculture, farming food. He is 59 years old, married, and has five children. He lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thiện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. Thiện has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thiện has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that he faces is not having money to build a latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

With his business profit, Thiện hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his children to find good jobs, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es un señorita de 24 años vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Guineales.
 
Irma es una mujer que quiere prosperar en la vida mientras sigue soltera, ella desde muy pequeña le gustaba estar con su hermana cuando ella tejía. Pues a la edad de aproximadamente de 10 años , ella empezó a tejer ahora ella se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica como: güipiles y fajas de diferentes clases y tamaños, este trabajo lo realiza desde su casa, con los años de experiencia que tiene, es muy buscada por la gente, y le hacen pedidos, pero ella con el poco capital que tiene no puede comprar suficiente materia prima, la materia prima que ella utiliza son de diferentes tonalidades, pues para tener todo lo necesario ella solicita un préstamo, que le servirá para comprar hilos y otros insumos.
 
Uno de los sueños de Irma es generar más ingresos, y con las ganancias pueda contratar más mujeres que le ayuden con los tejidos para que ella pueda exportar güipiles  para otros mercados,  ella por ahora necesita tres mil quetzales. Ella espera que ADICLA le dé esta oportunidad para lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Irma, 24, lives with her parents and siblings in a community of Guineales. 

Irma is a woman who wants to prosper in life while she is not married. From a very young age she liked being with her sister when she weaved. From the age of about 10, she started weaving and now she works making traditional clothing such as güipiles (traditional blouses and dresses), and corsets of different kinds and sizes. She does this work from home and with the years of experience she has she is very much in demand and takes orders. However, with the little capital she has, she cannot buy enough raw materials. The materials she uses are of different colours, so in order to have everything she needs, she is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy threads and other supplies.

One of Irma's dreams is to increase her income, and with her earnings she will be able to hire more women who can help her with the weaving so that she can export her güipiles to other markets. For now she needs 3000 quetzales. She hopes that ADICLA can give her this opportunity to realise her dreams.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Thoch's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Thoch is a 47-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 27 years. To better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker in a local area. Together, they can earn about 47,000 KHR per day to meet family’s needs, and they manage to save about 22,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Thoch’s group consists of four members who are only with VisionFund for this cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily, and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living, and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en: Mrs. Javzandulam, 55 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook at a restaurant since 2013. Her husband transports goods between districts using his heavy truck. Their two sons study at university. Using her previous loan, she paid tuition fees for her younger son. Now she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy spare parts for her husband's heavy truck. The heavy truck used by her husband has deteriorated over the years, and on its last trip, the interior engine broke. It became urgent to repair the truck, as her husband's work contributes greatly to her family's income. In the profile picture, the borrower is with her husband.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair broken heavy truck

loans.name: Putpisey

texts.en: Putpisey is an 18-year-old single woman who is a freshman pursuing a public administration degree at university in the city. She is from Svay Reang province of Cambodia. Her father is a deputy principal and her mother is a farmer who also sells gas at home. Putpisey needs financial support to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year and therefore she would like a loan. This loan will help her pursue the bachelor’s degree despite the financial shortage of her family. After graduation, she hopes that she will get a high-paying job to improve her living standards. She also wants to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Lý Bắc Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Dự is 51 years old and married with two children. She has a retail business selling salt, sugar, milk, cake, and other items. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Dự is also the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn Lý Bắc xã Thăng bình solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

The main harship that Dự faces in her business is the lack of capital. In 2011, she joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. So far she has successfully repaid four loans from this fund.

Dự is now requesting a loan to purchase more stock to resell. With her business profit, Dự hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to resell.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es: Virgilia de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Virgilia, 49 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their three children.  For many years, she works in the production and sale of tortillas.  Her business is located in her residence and she has many customers.  She is asking for credit to purchase corn and lime powder, in order to continue making tortillas and as a result, have a better income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn and lime powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc.

loans.name: Matilde Del Carmen

texts.es: Matilde tiene 40 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 13 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Matilde is 40 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. For 13 years, she has had a little store located in her place of residence. She has many customers because of the good prices and the friendliness that she shows at the time of sale. 

She is applying for a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc. for her store

loans.name: Azimahon

texts.en: Azimahon is a responsible woman. She was born in 1960, is a married mother of four children and lives in rural area. Her husband is a taxi driver. About 25 years ago she started a business sewing and selling napkins. She embroiders traditional napkins and her business is doing well with a lot of satisfied clients. She is an honest, generous and nice person. She is planning to buy materials and equipment for sewing napkins. Azimahon is asking for financial support to buy the materials.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment for sewing napkins

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Eng is 39 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She has five dependent children, all of whom are still in school. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 19 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 50,000 KHR per day and save about 25,000 KHR each day for future needs. 
Eng just joined VisionFund for this first loan. She is leading her group to ask for the loan. Eng will use her portion to buy rice seed for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy rice seed for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal is a 50-year-old married rice farmer with four children, who lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She also makes snack food to sell. Phal has cultivated rice since 1987. Among all the children, three of them are working in a factory in the city and one attends school. Her husband (shown in the photo) is 63 years old and is also a rice farmer. Now she would like to take out a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work. This loan will help her children to improve their traveling conditions. In the future, Phal wants to buy cows to fatten, save money to build a new house and help her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Sharifboy

texts.en: Sharifboy is a generous man. He was born in 1956. He is living in a village. He is married. He has five children. His wife helps to do business. He has an agricultural business. They plant crops, peas, haricots, apples and pears and sell them in the domestic market. Besides that, he keeps livestock. Every year he enlarges the number of cattle and gets a profit from it. It is hard for him to feed his big family. Sharifboy is planning to widen his activity. He needs financial support to buy cattle and materials to keep them.

loans.use: to buy cattle to widen his activity.

loans.name: Ametes

texts.en: Ametes is a 25-year-old married woman from the province of Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods to her neighbors.  For more than a year now, this business has provided her the income that she needs to support her family, especially for the schooling of her one child. Ametes is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, cooking oil and condiments, processed meat like chorizo (sausage) and tocino (bacon), bread and biscuits, coffee and sugar, soap and detergents and others. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, cooking oil and condiments, processed meat like chorizo (sausage) and tocino (bacon), bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn Lý Nam Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 45 years old and married with three children. She works in agriculture, raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Hoa is also the group leader of the Nhóm 04 thôn Lý Nam xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is a lack of capital. In 2014, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from this fund. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more young pigs to raise and later sell.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase young pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en: Irine is a Kiva borrower. She has a child who is 4 years old. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with high customer inflow and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have multiple businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Thôn Ngọ Trung Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Thảo is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. She works in agriculture, raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Thảo is also the group leader of the Nhóm 12 thôn Ngọ Trung Ngọ hạ xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is a lack of capital. In 2010, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from that fund. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more young poultry to raise and later sell.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her business to improve, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase young poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janeth works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure (service) business in the Philippines and earns additional income from motorcycle transport and food vending. Janeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional nail polish, nippers, and other materials needed for her manicure and pedicure (service) business.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nail polish, nippers, and other materials needed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and married with three children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for tw years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 49 years old, lives with his wife and 2 youngest children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been making and selling wooden products to local customers since 2003.
