Jargalsaikhan's wife helps in his business by preparing documents and recording sales revenue. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy large quantities of wooden planks, for later use, since current prices are relatively lower than that of previous years. 

This business is the main income source for Jargalsaikhan's family, and, even still, he needs to graduate his 2 youngest children from university.

loans.use: to purchase wooden planks in large quantities.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus 04 hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será destinado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno (vacas) y toretes para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos, con esto Andres espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Andres, age 40, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his life partner and their four children.  They live in the Querocotillo district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  Life in the district is peaceful.  The population mainly works in agriculture, in commerce, and with livestock.

He raises cows, and he has over ten years of experience in the business.  He has very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan is to buy more livestock (cows and young bulls) to fatten and later sell.  With this Andres hopes to improve the productivity of his business.  This will allow him to increase his level of income and, therefore, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock (cows and young bulls) to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Men is 63 years old and married. She has three children. To support her big family, she and her husband farm rice and work for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 43 years, her family earns about 50,700 KHR per day from this business to meet her family’s needs.
 
This is the first cycle for her group with VisionFund. She is now leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and to pay for labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Lý Tây Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Cần is 32 years old and married with two children. She has a retail business selling grocery items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Cần is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn Lý Tây Xã Thăng bình solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

The main hardship that Cần faces in her business is a lack of capital. In 2014, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from this fund. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more milk, sugar, salt, cake,and other items to sell.

In the future, Cần hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 22 Thôn Lý Đông Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Dung is 35 years old, and married with two children. She has a retail business selling grocery items which she has been involved in for six years. She is also the group leader of the Nhóm 22 thôn Lý Đông xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

The main hardship Dung faces in her business is a lack of capital. In 2011, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from this fund. She is now applying for a loan to purchase more milk, sugar, salt, cake, and other items to sell.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Jema is the mother of one son who is at school. She is married and in her early thirties. For three years now, she has been running a business buying, raising and selling goats and ducks. She started her business with five goats and ten ducks. With good effort and hard work, Jema is now able to raise 30 goats and 80 ducks. It has been a working spirit from Jema. She dreams of raising her animals in a modern way.

Jema starts working at 9 am when she feeds the animals and at 11 am customers arrive to buy animals. Her business ends at 4 pm daily and she is able to raise a good return per month.

This is her seventeenth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credits, which she paid back successfully, to improve her business, moving from 5 to 30 goats and 10 to 80 ducks and managing her animals' feeding well. She is so thankful for Kiva's support and to everyone who has shown and keeps showing great support to her group. The extra income she receives goes to her son's fees, household expenses and to plow back to her business. With the seventeenth credit request, Jema will invest in buying goats and raising more ducks to sell.

She will share this loan with her group, Wega, consisting of five women who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy goats and raise more ducks to sell.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, who is 38 years old, resides in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker with a daily earning of USD 4.00. So far, she has been in this career for four years. She married to Von, 50, a rice farmer with a daily earning of USD 3.00. This couple does not have children yet.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Tupo Juu Sana Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her mid-twenties, is married and has three children. One of her children goes to school, while the other two are still too small to attend. 

Zena has been supporting her family with her beauty salon business, serving customers for one-and-half years now. She works from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm each working day and is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

This is Zena's first application for credit from Tujijenge Tanzania, which will be apportioned among the eight group members of Tupo Juu Sana. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.  

Zena will invest her loan portion in the purchase of hair dressing equipment. Her dream is to improve her service with modern equipment.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing equipment.

loans.name: Maria Herminia Estrella

texts.es:
Picoazá está ubicada a 10 minutos de la zona urbana de Portoviejo, cuenta con una rica y añeja historia que data desde 1535. Las investigaciones llevadas adelante durante el 2010 en Cerro de Hojas - Jaboncillo han sido fundamentales para entender el nivel de desarrollo y planificación de la producción y la reproducción de la sociedad Manteña, cultura representativa de la costa que se extendió en Santa Elena, Guayas y Manabí.
La señora María tiene 73 años, es viuda desde hace 10 años y de este matrimonio tuvo 5 hijos mayores de edad, tiene casa  propia y vive con una hija.
Doña María tiene una ferretería en su casa la cual es atendida por ella y su hija todos los día, los créditos le han ayudado a seguir con su ferretería luego que su esposo falleció.
Este crédito va a invertir en mercadería para la ferretería  como (toma corrientes, focos ahorradores, enchufes, cables, etc.)
Ella esta agradecida ya que le gusta ser parte del grupo y de la fundación.
texts.en:
Picoazá is located ten minutes from the urban area of Portoviejo.  It has a rich and ancient history that dates back to 1535.  The investigations carried out in Cerro de Hojas – Jaboncillo in the year 2010 have been fundamental in understanding the level of development and planning in the production and reproduction of the Manteña society.  It is the representative culture of the coast that extended to Santa Elena, Guayas, and Manabí. 

María, age 73, has been a widow for ten years.  She and her husband had five children who are now adults.  She has her own house and lives with a daughter.

María has a hardware store at her house.  She and her daughter tend the store every day.  The loans have helped her to continue with the hardware store after her husband died.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise for the hardware store.  She will buy things like electric outlets, energy saving light bulbs, plugs, and cables, etc.

She is grateful because she likes being part of the group and the foundation.

loans.use: to buy electric outlets, energy saving light bulbs, plugs, and cables, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 25 years old, married, and blessed with 2 children. While she cares for her little children she manages a small retail store in their village. She has been in this business for almost 4 years. 

Jovelyn aspires to improve her business and increase her income in order to sustain the necessities of her family. Due to lack of capital, she would like to take 48,000 PHP loan in order to buy more grocery inventory, such as rice and LPG (liquid petroleum gas) tanks to resell. 

Jovelyn is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of grocery items such as rice and LPG tanks to resell.

loans.name: Job

texts.en: Job is a Kiva borrower. He has one child who is five years old. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area with high customer inflow. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, washing soap and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self sustainable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, washing soap and other items.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Banco Mujer Fuerzas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Keylin y su grupo continuan trabajando muy unidas, se mantienen las 9 socias que fundadoron el grupo y continuan con sus actividades agropecuarias y de pequeña industria. Solicitan su tercer préstamo. 
Para Keylin los créditos anteriores han sido de gran ayuda, ya que ha podido fortalecer su negocio y generar ingresos, contribuyendo así a mejorar las condiciones de vida, y seguir estudiando tanto ella, como sus hijas. Actualmente Keylin estás más enfocada en la cría de animales como pollos y cerdos, sin embargo mantiene un pequeño espacio de terreno con hortalizas sembradas para autoconsumo y venta en menor escala. Para está nueva inyección de capital de trabajo piensa comprar más animales y los insumos necesarios para su cria y desarrollo. Ella y su grupo continuan luchando por alcanzar sus metas y los objetivos que se ha propuesto como grupo. En el caso de Keylin ya está por terminar la secundaria, y piensa seguir estudiando, además de seguir apoyando a sus hijas para qye tambien lo hagan, siendo ella su mejor ejemplo de esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Keilyn and her group continue working together. The nine members who founded the group remain together and continue running their ranching and small business operations. They are requesting their third loan.

For Keilyn, the previous loans have been very useful because through them she has been able to strengthen her business and generate income—a situation that has allowed her and her daughters to improve their living conditions and continue with their studies.

Currently, Keilyn is more focused on breeding animals such as chickens and pigs. However, she keeps a small plot of land where she grows produce for her family's own consumption and for sale in a smaller scale. 

With this new capital injection, she is planning on buying more animals and the supplies needed for their breeding and rearing. 

She and her group keep on striving to reach their goals and meet the objectives that they have set out to achieve as a group. In Keilyn's case, she is about to finish high school, and she is planning on continuing with her studies and supporting her daughters so that they do it too. She wants to be a role model of hard work and dedication for them.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, chickens, and supplies for their breeding and rearing such as vitamins, concentrated feed and other items.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a hardworking man. Through loans at MUK, he developed his business in the field of buying and selling fish, salt ponds and selling fish feed. After undergoing several months with his business and making several payments, he received an order of fish feed in large quantities. He received a satisfactory profit and was able to make his loan repayment before the due date. Usman is very happy because all the hard work paid off with maximum results.

Because his service to customers is very satisfactory, he got an order of fish feed from different customers. For that, he needs additional capital for his business. Currently, Usman orders not only feed for fish, but also feed for shrimp. He is optimistic he will get satisfactory results and all the family needs and dreams can be achieved. The loan will be used to buy feed for the fish and feed for the shrimp to sell it again.

loans.use: to buy feed for the fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows coffee and other crops. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are large scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a  Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells soda, bananas, mangoes and other items. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits, soda and other items. She also does farming. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, soda and other items.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Sallique, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de reparación de motos, generadores de luz, entre otros aparatos electrónicos. Cuenta con 20 años de experiencia en el rubro y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de repuestos para motos y una mayor cantidad de materiales para implementar su negocio, esto le generará mayores ingresos y por ende le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 43 years old, in a common law marriage, and he lives with his wife and children in Salique district, located in Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The population of this district is dedicated principally to agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising.

Gilberto offers repair services for motorcycles and electric generators, among other electronic apparatuses. He has 20 years experience in this specialty and has a set group of customers who provide very good personal and work references for him. 

Gilberto's loan will be invested in purchasing replacement parts for motorcycles, and for a larger quantity of materials for use in his business. This should generate better income and, in the end, permit him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing replacement parts for motorcycles and, also, a larger quantity of materials to implement his repair business.

loans.name: Maria Janet

texts.en: Maria Janet is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional items, such as vinegar, sugar, spices, to sell. Maria Janet has borrowed and repaid two prior loans from NWTF, and has been running her general store for three years. She earns additional income from food vending, and from buying and selling frozen products. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth is 31 years old and married, with three children. With two children who are still in school, Jeaneth works very hard to provide for her family.

Jeaneth runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, spices, and sugar.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Jeaneth has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, spices, and sugar.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: As the married parent of seven children, Elena works hard to support her family. She earns a living in the Philippines by fishing and supplements her income by raising pigs. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy supplies for her fishing business. Elena has sustained her business activities through four prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her reach her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 59 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her needs.

Gregoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, groceries, etc..

Gregoria has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 50 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional merchandise like shampoo, rice, soap, etc. to sell.

Jesusa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like shampoo, rice, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
A widowed parent of 11 children, Joan works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

Joan is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
Josita is a hardworking entrepreneur who does business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Josita has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Josita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 55 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 5000 loan from NWTF to buy additional items, such as noodles, soap, and shampoo, to sell. Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 27 prior loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for 17 years and also earns additional income from transport via motorcycle and pig raising. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en: Jenalie is 34 years old, married and the mother of seven children.  With four children in school, Jenalie works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as shampoo, sugar, canned goods, and noodles. She successfully repaid a previous loan and will use the new one to further build her businesses. Jenalie has been in her current line of work for five years and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Sari Rejeki Group

texts.en:
The Sari Rejeki Group can pay off the loan on-time. During the previous six months, the group succeeded in maintaining the pigs. Besides being controlled by the Field Officer, they were also regulary visited by the veterinarian. That’s way the pigs can grow well.

Ni Luh Putu, as the head, is responsible for the group and the repayment. She maintains three local pigs and has sold out. Although, in this period, she hasn’t earned a satisfactory profit, she still continues the business and, with the full support of her husband, she expects another loan from Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK).

This is the sixth loan for Sari Rejeki Group and they got an increased loan size. They are borrowing a new loan to continue the business. They still keep their spirits to run this business. They hope they will get a better result this period. The vet suggested to them that they give more nutrious feed and vitamins to the pigs. Ni Luh Putu needs a larger, new loan to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins, and feed. 

Ni Luh Putu hopes she can earn more profit this time and all will be used for saving. One member resigned for several reasons and she was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins, and feed.

loans.name: Donyor

texts.en: Donyor is a strong man who was born in 1980 and lives in a rural area. He is a kind, goal-oriented and hard-working person. The area where he lives has good conditions for agricultural plantings and keeping livestock. From his childhood, Donyor has helped his parents and knows how to look after agricultural products and cattle. After graduation from high school, he got married. He has two children. His wife is a housekeeper and helps him with the livestock. They planted carrots, onions, potatoes and other vegetables for selling in the domestic market. It has been hard for him to feed his family. Donyor even went abroad to earn some money but decided that it would be better to enlarge his business. He is planning to rent land and buy seed for planting. He is asking for financial support to buy seed and rent land.

loans.use: To buy seed and to pay for renting land

loans.name: Visezi Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his early 60s, is married with six children; one of them is still at school but the rest are all grown up. He has been running a gengeduka (small grocery shop) for three years now. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salum's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase his gengeduka stock. He dreams of buying maize grains to make and sell as maize flour.

Salum will share this loan with his loan group, Visezi Group, which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his gengeduka (small grocery shop) stock.

loans.name: Tujuane Kibaha Group

texts.en:
Esta is in her late 20s, married and has two children, one who is school-age and another who is still young. Esta has a mamalishe business: a local restaurant serving rice, ugali, chapati with beans, meat sauce and vegetables. She has been with this business for one year, working from 7:00am to midnight every day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

Esta is requesting her first loan via Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She interested in improving her business so as to attract more people, such as being able to serve varieties of food. She will invest her loan to replenish her business with cooking ingredients, such as sacks of rice, maize and baking flour, cooking oil, beans and sugar. She dreams to improve her mamalishe to make it look good.

Esta will share this loan with her group, TUJUANE KIBAHA, consisting of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with cooking ingredients, such as sacks of rice, maize and baking flour, cooking oil, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Ligia Ramona

texts.es:
Portoviejo, capital de la Provincia de Manabí, a 35 km de la ciudad de Manta. Está ubicada a pocos minutos de la playa de Crucita, donde se puede estar en contacto con la naturaleza y disfrutar del sol y de sus tranquilas olas.  Con su clima cálido seco.
Aquí vive la señora Ligia, tiene 61 años, está casada y de este matrimonio tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad,  su esposo trabaja comercializando productos cárnicos.
Doña Ligia es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo (Leonisa) y productos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja sola todos los días a la semana seis  horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene veinte años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los cosméticos.
El Crédito lo solicita para comprar ropa y cosméticos en promoción y así obtener más ganancias. Es socia de La Fundación desde hace veinte años. Le gusta la apertura de los créditos, los intereses bajos y la facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Portoviejo, capital of the Manabí Province, is 35 km from the city of Manta. It is situated a few minutes from the Crucita beach, where one can be in touch with nature and enjoy the sun and the peaceful waves. It has a warm, dry climate.

This is where Ligia, 61 years old, lives. She is married and has 4 adult children from this marriage. Her husband works selling meat products.

Ligia is a housewife who, in order to earn her own money and thus help her husband with household expenses, makes a living selling clothes from a catalog (Leonisa) and Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She works alone everyday of the week, six hours a day. She sells her products on credit, and collects every week.

She has been in this business for twenty years, and it is going very well for her. She sells more cosmetics than anything else.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy clothes and cosmetics on sale and thus increase her earnings. She has been a member of La Fundación for 20 years. She likes the access to credit, the low interest rates, and the ease of payment.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Daisy May

texts.en:
Daisy May is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She wants to help her husband in earning income to cover the necessities of her family. She has worked as a cashier in a  gasoline station for almost four years. 

Due to financial hardship, she would like to engage in direct selling of Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk and MSE products to have additional income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access a loan of PHP10,000 to buy said products to resell in their village. She is hoping that she will access her loan request to be able to start said business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon, Natasha, Board Walk and MSE products to resell

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli is a hardworking father of three. He is 30 years old and raises his family in a rural community. He earns a living through farming. Aside from this, he also operates a motorcycle transport business to generate additional income. 

Despite hardship in his life, he has the determination to improve the living status of his family. To continuously operate his motorcycle, he needs to request an additional loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the needed motorcycle parts and accessories and to pay for the renewal of his license. Through this financial assistance, Noli believes that someday, he will improve his business and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts and accessories and to pay for the renewal of his license.

loans.name: Ma. Belinda

texts.en:
Ma. Belinda is 46 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and other livestock to raise.

Ma. Belinda has been buying and selling livestock for 25 years and also earns income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to  save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and other livestock to raise

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 50 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rita is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rita has been in this business for two years and earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 53 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, groceries, etc.

Sarah has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, biscuits, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 56 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc.

Merlita has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, eggs, beverages, etc

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and vegetable vending businesses. Violeta is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rubelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell shrimp business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Rubelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy shrimp to sell through her buy-and-sell shrimp business.

Rubelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Nica

texts.en: Nica is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a vegetable-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 19,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has been in her current line of work for 12 years, and supplements her income by running a general store and by selling coconut wine. Nica has sustained her business activities through her own hard work and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Geraldine is 34 years old. Four of her children are still in school.

Geraldine has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell at her business.

Geraldine has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell at her business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Perlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Perlita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell at her fish vending business.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell at her business.

loans.name: Vibol's Group

texts.en:
Vibol is 35 years old and married with five children, all dependents and still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Banteay Meas district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for 15 years. She also raises pigs and sometimes she sells snacks. The current business earns her about 17,000 KHR per day.   
Vibol’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has been a member of VisionFund for three loans already. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is a citizen from a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district in Kandal province. Sorn is a 50-year-old mother of three children, one still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 33 years. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day. 
This is the first loan for Sorn from VisionFund. She is applying for loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn lives in a wooden house located in the Kratie District of Kratie Province. Savoeurn is 27 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for nine years and sometimes she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 44,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 22,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 
This is the third micro loan for Savoeurn with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to timely grow her rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Syeda Sharmila

texts.en: Syeda Sharmila is a 35-year-old married mother of four children. Her husband (also shown in the photo), runs a van transportation business. Her husband owns one van and needs some financial help. He will use the loan to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van to provide better services to his passengers. Therefore, Syeda Sharmila has taken out a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business, to continue maintaining her finances and to be able to cover her expenses.

loans.name: Kely

texts.es:
Kely tiene 33 años, vive en casa familiar con padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, cuentan con servicios básicos como agua y luz eléctrica.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, gallinas, patos, entre otros, desde hace más de 05 años, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como patos, pavos, gallinas, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. El objetivo de Kely es ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Kely is 33 years old. She lives in the family home with her parents in the district of Cayaltí, situated in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The population of this district makes its living primarily in agriculture, livestock, and commerce. They have basic services such as water and electricity.

Kely has made her living raising and selling small animals such as turkeys, hens, and ducks, among others, for more than 5 years. She has experience in this business, and has very good personal and professional references in the area.

The goal of the loan will be to purchase a greater number of animals such as ducks, turkeys, and hens, among others, as well as to buy feed for these animals.

Kely's goal is to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers, which will allow her to increase her level of income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of animals, like ducks, turkeys, hens, among others, as well as feed for these animals.

loans.name: Julanie

texts.en:
Ma. Julanie is 42 years old and is married with 4 children.

Ma. Julanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional inventory to sell like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc.  

Ma. Julanie has previously borrowed and successfully repaid 21 loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for 11 years, though she also earns income from buying and selling charcoal and farming sugarcane.

Ma. Julanie has successfully repaid her most recent loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 53 years old, married and has six children.

She is in the agricultural business of farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. Dominga requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dominga has been farming corn and vegetables for 11 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Dominga would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Elvie works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. 

Elvie is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She has successfully repaid her most recent loan, and now she is requesting another loan to further build her businesses.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her to pay for university fees for her and her brother.

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar is a young woman, 37 years old, from a small village in Akhalisopeli, Senaki district. She has a four-member family, (husband and two children) and they don't have any significant income for existence. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category and lives under poverty. The family members get social assistance from the local government. 

Mzevinar has a great desire to do her part for the family's welfare and to be involved in her own business. She requested a loan, but her application was rejected several times due to lack of income or business experience. 

Mzevinar's loan request has now been approved by a start up program, a joint initiative of Kiva and LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo, which gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. 

Mzevinar plans to purchase clothing stock and other accessories for babies and she will start local sales. She will sell products from her house and will be able to generate her own income. The loan will greatly assist Mzevinar and her family, enabling them to cover daily costs and improve their living conditions. They await your help.

loans.use: to begin to sell clothes.

loans.name: Suzzete

texts.en:
Suzzete, 35, is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Three of her children are in school.

Suzzete has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Suzzete requested a 6000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

Suzzete has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 70 years old and is married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more inventory to sell in her store.

Lilia has been in this business for 45 years, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase necessary furniture for her house.

loans.name: Horiat Al- Wadi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Horiat Al-Wadi. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Horia is the leader of the group and a mother of four children, living with her children in an old house in a poor quarter. Her husband has emigrated outside the country. The amount he sends her monthly is not enough to cover most of the children expenses.

The house where Horia and her children live is old and needs a lot of renovation on the inside. Horia doesn't have enough money to renovate it. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement and sand to make some of the necessary renovations to the house.

Horia hopes to build the second floor to rent.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to make some of the necessary renovations to her house.

loans.name: Zaiba

texts.en: Zaiba is a 35-year-old working woman. After she married, she felt that she should help her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a clothing sales business in her locality. Zaiba believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and support their education. She is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Zaiba has taken out a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase good-quality clothes in different colors and styles to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothes in different colors and styles

loans.name: Walter Ismael

texts.es:
Walter Ismael tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material noble junto a su cónyuge en la provincia de Morropón, ubicado en la región de Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. Es una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 15 años, contando con experiencia en el negocio y clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del crédito será para realizar reparaciones y mejoramiento del local donde vende el pescado, así como para la compra de contenedores donde almacenará sus productos, con esto Walter Ismael espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias, lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter Ismael is 52 years old.  He lives in his own home in common law marriage with his partner in the province of Morropón. This is located in the region of Piura, on the north coast of Perú. It is a community where life is peaceful. Its population is engaged mainly in the economic activities of agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He makes a living selling fish, an activity he has been doing for over 15 years. With his experience in this business, he has regular customers who provide very good personal and work references for him.

The loan will be used for repairs and improvements to the stall where he sells fish, and for the purchase of containers where he stores his products.  With these changes, Walter Ismael wants to offer a better quality product for his customers, satisfying their tastes and preferences.  This will have a big impact on his income level and will allow him to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and improvements to the stall where he sells fish and to buy containers where he can store his products.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Janeth requested a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell at her business.

Janeth has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell at her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 38 years old, married and has two children who are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business of farming corn in the Philippines. Elisa requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers.

Elisa has been farming corn for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Judith is 43 years old. One of her children is still in school.

Judith has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish that she can sell at her business.

Judith has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish that she can sell at her business.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Muna is the mother of four. She has worked as an officer in a company. She starts work at 8:00 am and finishes at 5:00 pm, Saturday to Thursday. She does this work to provide for her household expenses.

Muna requested an education loan, which will be used to pay for university costs, such as graduation and tuition costs for her daughter. This will allow her daughter to continue to study and to become a professional.

loans.use: to pay for university costs, such as graduation and tuition costs for her daughter.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 53 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ignacia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ignacia has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 53 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., for resale.

Mary Ann has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Juliana works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Juliana is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell at her fish vending business.

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell at her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 42 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Merly has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 46 years old and married with two children. With her two children still in school, Beverly works very hard to provide for her family.

Beverly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, sugar, canned goods, and soap for resale.

Beverly has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, sugar, canned goods, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell at her business.

Julieta has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from raising hogs.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell at her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius comes from Kashangura cell, Ibanda district. He is single but takes care of his elderly parents.

He deals in agriculture, mainly coffee farming. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him buy pesticides and mulch for his coffee plantation. He will use the rest of the money to renovate his parents’ house since its too old. He hopes to be the best coffee farmer in the whole village, producing 100 bags per season. 

His major challenges are price fluctuations and, at times, unpredictable weather changes after he has invested loan money, affecting his cash flow and profit. Despite these challenges, Julius is a very hardworking man and honest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and mulch for his coffee farm, and to renovate his parents' house.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 55-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her child. She has been selling personal use products for several years. Her business is located at her place of residence, but she also sells as a street vendor by going to different neighborhoods.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy perfumes, lotions, crèmes, shampoo, deodorants, and other products in bulk so that she can continue her work and have more income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, crèmes, shampoo, deodorants, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Xiomara Lucinda

texts.es:
Picoaza está ubicada a 10 minutos de la zona urbana de Portoviejo, cuenta con una rica y añeja historia que data desde 1535. Las investigaciones llevadas adelante durante el 2010 en Cerro de Hojas - Jaboncillo han sido fundamentales para entender el nivel de desarrollo y planificación de la producción y la reproducción de la sociedad Manteña, cultura representativa de la costa que se extendió en Santa Elena, Guayas y Manabí.
La señora Xiomara tiene 35 años, es casada,  su esposo es comerciante, tiene 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 8 años que estudian 2 en el colegio y 1 en la escuela,  viven en su casa  propia. 
Doña Xiomara viaja todos los días con su esposo a la ciudad de Manta  donde tienen un pequeño local de venta de carteras, atienden  todos los días de 8 am a 5pm.  Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 12 años que se dedican a esta actividad y leas va muy bien
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar carteras. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace cuatro años  y le gusta por la unión y la responsabilidad del grupo.  Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Picoaza is located 10 minutes from the urban area of Portoviejo and has a rich culture and history that dates back to 1535.  The research done during 2010 at Cerro de Hojas – Jaboncillo has been fundamental in understanding the level of planning and development, production, and reproduction of the Manteña society, representative of the coastal culture that extends to Santa Elena, Guayas, and Manabí.

Xiomara is 35 years old, married and has three children, ages 16, 13, and 8.  Two attend high school and one attends elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.  They own their home.

Xiomara travels to the city everyday with her husband.  They have a small shop where they sell wallets and work daily from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or once a month as needed.  They have been doing this for 12 years and things are going well for them.

She will use the money from this loan to buy wallets.  She has been a member of the lending group for four years and she likes the group’s unity and responsibility.  Her dreams are to see her children finish school and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy wallets.

loans.name: Sanidad

texts.en:
Sanidad is aged 45, married and blessed with six children. He has managed a corn farming business in their village for almost three years, and he earned a net income last harvest season amounting to PHP 120,000.

Due to insufficient funds for his farming business, he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to PHP 45,000 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm.

He's hoping that his farming business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Sagrado Corazón De Jesús, este grupo formado por 11 mujeres y dos hombres que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este grupo con el cual han mejorado sus negocios y su vida.
Uno de los integrantes de este grupo es don Jhonny, tiene 43 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de ellos mayores  de edad y uno de 9 años el cual estudia en escuela. Su esposa es amada de casa.
El señor Jhonny es un hombre muy trabajador que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para darles a su familia lo necesario, el se dedica al comercio, todos los días se desplaza hasta Machalilla lugar en el cual compra el mejor pescado el mismo que luego en su moto se encarga de vender por la localidad y por sitios aledaños por donde tiene muchos clientes que a menudo le compran sus productos,  lleva más de 20  años en esta labor con la cual se gana algo por el bien de la familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado y otros mariscos. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que a su familia no les falte lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diverse typical products such as straw hats and shawls widely known inside and outside of the country, the members of the Credit Group Sagrado Corazon de Jesus meet every 15 days. This group, formed by 11 women and 2 men, got together long ago and formed this group to better their businesses and their lives. One of the members of this group is Mr. Jhonny. He is 43 years old, married, with 3 children from this union. Two of the children are adults and one is 9 year old and he is in school. His wife is a homemaker. Mr Jhonny is a hard working man who works very diligently to give his family what is needed. He works in trading, going to Machalilla every day to buy the best fish which he distributes in his motorcycle to sell in his neighborhood and adjacent areas. He has many clients who buy his products. He has done this job for over 20 years, which has helped him earn something for the family. This loan is to buy fish and other seafood. This is his first period with the Credit Group and he likes it because the loans are of great help to him. His dream is that his family gets what is necessary to live.

loans.use: To purchase fish and seafood.

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Hamisi, who is married, is a man of 30 years and a father of two kids. He has been supporting his family with a business selling fruits like oranges, bananas, and avocados, and sometimes Irish potatoes. He has been in this business for four years now, working from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily. He is able to make a fair profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his second credit request to be apportioned among Nzasa, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Hamisi used the previous credit to buy bananas and Irish potatoes. He managed to earn extra income which he used to cover household expenses. With the new credit, he will buy more stock of fruits for his business. 

Hamisi dreams of building a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruits for his business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 43 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marivic has been in the agricultural business for eight years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 48 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Evangeline has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evangeline has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives in Batumi, Seaside of Georgia with her husband and parents-in-law.

Inga is a stylist at local beauty salon and gets a stable monthly income. She owns a flat in Batumi and wants to rent it out to get additional income. She needs money for renovation, as the flat is old and need to be repaired.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1200 USD. With the received credit she will be able to make some cosmetic updates to the flat, and she will be able to rent the flat at a good price.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out.

loans.name: Jeza

texts.en:
Jeza is 27 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jeza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Jeza has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, canned goods, and spices.

In the future, Jeza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun is a 28-year-old married mother with a dependent child. She lives in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She earns her income by making and selling snack food. She has been in business for more than a year. Her husband, a 29-year-old, works in a factory in the city. Bun and her husband can earn 9 US Dollars per day. She wants to improve her husband’s traveling conditions, so she would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to use to commute to work. Bun also wants to save money to build a house and to help her child to achieve a high level of education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to use to commute to work.
